Start Commercial.short: Starts a commercial on the specified channel.
Start Commercial.long:
Starts a commercial on the specified channel.
*NOTE*: Only partners and affiliates may run commercials and they must be streaming live at the time.
*NOTE*: Only the broadcaster may start a commercial; the broadcaster’s editors and moderators may not start commercials on behalf of the broadcaster.

reqBody.name: broadcaster_id
reqBody.description: The ID of the partner or affiliate broadcaster that wants to run the commercial. This ID must match the user ID found in the OAuth token.

reqBody.name: length
reqBody.description: The length of the commercial to run, in seconds. Twitch tries to serve a commercial that’s the requested length, but it may be shorter or longer. The maximum length you should request is 180 seconds.

reqBody.name: data
reqBody.description: An array that contains a single object with the status of your start commercial request.

reqBody.name: length
reqBody.description: The length of the commercial you requested. If you request a commercial that’s longer than 180 seconds, the API uses 180 seconds.

reqBody.name: message
reqBody.description: A message that indicates whether Twitch was able to serve an ad.

reqBody.name: retry_after
reqBody.description: The number of seconds you must wait before running another commercial.

codes.200: Successfully started the commercial.
codes.400:
- The broadcaster_id query parameter is required.
- The length query parameter is required.
- The ID in broadcaster_id is not valid.
- To start a commercial, the broadcaster must be streaming live.
- The broadcaster may not run another commercial until the cooldown period expires. The `retry_after` field in the previous start commercial response specifies the amount of time the broadcaster must wait between running commercials.
codes.401:
- The ID in `broadcaster_id` must match the user ID found in the request’s OAuth token.
- The Authorization header is required and must contain a user access token.
- The user access token must include the channel:edit:commercial scope.
- The OAuth token is not valid.
- The client ID specified in the Client-Id header does not match the client ID specified in the OAuth token.
codes.404: - The ID in `broadcaster_id` was not found.
codes.429: - The broadcaster may not run another commercial until the cooldown period expires. The `retry_after` field in the previous start commercial response specifies the amount of time the broadcaster must wait between running commercials.

Start Commercial.auth: Requires a [user access token](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/authentication#user-access-tokens) that includes the *channel:edit:commercial* scope.

Get Ad Schedule.long: This endpoint returns ad schedule related information, including snooze, when the last ad was run, when the next ad is scheduled, and if the channel is currently in pre-roll free time. Note that a new ad cannot be run until 8 minutes after running a previous ad.

params.name: broadcaster_id
params.description: Provided `broadcaster_id` must match the `user_id` in the auth token.

reqBody.name: data
reqBody.description: A list that contains information related to the channel’s ad schedule.

reqBody.name: snooze_count
reqBody.description: The number of snoozes available for the broadcaster.

reqBody.name: snooze_refresh_at
reqBody.description: The UTC timestamp when the broadcaster will gain an additional snooze, in RFC3339 format.

reqBody.name: next_ad_at
reqBody.description: The UTC timestamp of the broadcaster’s next scheduled ad, in RFC3339 format. Empty if the channel has no ad scheduled or is not live.

reqBody.name: duration
reqBody.description: The length in seconds of the scheduled upcoming ad break.

reqBody.name: last_ad_at
reqBody.description: The UTC timestamp of the broadcaster’s last ad-break, in RFC3339 format. Empty if the channel has not run an ad or is not live.

reqBody.name: preroll_free_time
reqBody.description: The amount of pre-roll free time remaining for the channel in seconds. Returns 0 if they are currently not pre-roll free.

codes.200: Returns the ad schedule information for the channel.
codes.400: The broadcaster ID is not valid.

Get Ad Schedule.auth: Requires a [user access token](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/authentication#user-access-tokens) that includes the *channel:read:ads* scope. The `user_id` in the user access token must match the `broadcaster_id`.

Snooze Next Ad.short: Pushes back the timestamp of the upcoming automatic mid-roll ad by 5 minutes.
Snooze Next Ad.long: If available, pushes back the timestamp of the upcoming automatic mid-roll ad by 5 minutes. This endpoint duplicates the snooze functionality in the creator dashboard’s Ads Manager.

params.name: broadcaster_id
params.description: Provided `broadcaster_id` must match the `user_id` in the auth token.

reqBody.name: data
reqBody.description: A list that contains information about the channel’s snoozes and next upcoming ad after successfully snoozing.

reqBody.name: snooze_count
reqBody.description: The number of snoozes available for the broadcaster.

reqBody.name: snooze_refresh_at
reqBody.description: The UTC timestamp when the broadcaster will gain an additional snooze, in RFC3339 format.

reqBody.name: next_ad_at
reqBody.description: The UTC timestamp of the broadcaster’s next scheduled ad, in RFC3339 format.

codes.200: User’s next ad is successfully snoozed. Their snooze_count is decremented and snooze_refresh_time and next_ad_at are both updated.
codes.400:
- The channel is not currently live.
- The broadcaster ID is not valid.
- Channel does not have an upcoming scheduled ad break.

Snooze Next Ad.auth: Requires a [user access token](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/authentication#user-access-tokens) that includes the *channel:manage:ads* scope. The `user_id` in the user access token must match the `broadcaster_id`.

Get Extension Analytics.short: Gets an analytics report for one or more extensions.
Get Extension Analytics.long: Gets an analytics report for one or more extensions. The response contains the URLs used to download the reports (CSV files). [Learn More](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/insights)

params.name: extension_id
params.description: The extension's client ID. If specified, the response contains a report for the specified extension. If not specified, the response includes a report for each extension that the authenticated user owns.

params.name: type
params.description: The type of analytics report to get. Possible values are:- overview_v2

params.name: started_at
params.description: The reporting window's start date, in RFC3339 format. Set the time portion to zeroes (for example, 2021-10-22T00:00:00Z).The start date must be on or after January 31, 2018. If you specify an earlier date, the API ignores it and uses January 31, 2018. If you specify a start date, you must specify an end date. If you don't specify a start and end date, the report includes all available data since January 31, 2018.The report contains one row of data for each day in the reporting window.

params.name: ended_at
params.description: The reporting window's end date, in RFC3339 format. Set the time portion to zeroes (for example, 2021-10-27T00:00:00Z). The report is inclusive of the end date.Specify an end date only if you provide a start date. Because it can take up to two days for the data to be available, you must specify an end date that's earlier than today minus one to two days. If not, the API ignores your end date and uses an end date that is today minus one to two days.

params.name: first
params.description: The maximum number of report URLs to return per page in the response. The minimum page size is 1 URL per page and the maximum is 100 URLs per page. The default is 20.*NOTE*: While you may specify a maximum value of 100, the response will contain at most 20 URLs per page.

params.name: after
params.description: The cursor used to get the next page of results. The *Pagination* object in the response contains the cursor’s value. [Read More](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/api/guide#pagination)This parameter is ignored if the extension_id parameter is set.

reqBody.name: data
reqBody.description: A list of reports. The reports are returned in no particular order; however, the data within each report is in ascending order by date (newest first). The report contains one row of data per day of the reporting window; the report contains rows for only those days that the extension was used. The array is empty if there are no reports.

reqBody.name: extension_id
reqBody.description: An ID that identifies the extension that the report was generated for.

reqBody.name: URL
reqBody.description: The URL that you use to download the report. The URL is valid for 5 minutes.

reqBody.name: type
reqBody.description: The type of report.

reqBody.name: date_range
reqBody.description: The reporting window’s start and end dates, in RFC3339 format.

reqBody.name: started_at
reqBody.description: The reporting window’s start date.

reqBody.name: ended_at
reqBody.description: The reporting window’s end date.

reqBody.name: pagination
reqBody.description: Contains the information used to page through the list of results. The object is empty if there are no more pages left to page through. [Read More](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/api/guide#pagination)

reqBody.name: cursor
reqBody.description: The cursor used to get the next page of results. Use the cursor to set the request’s after query parameter.

codes.200: Successfully retrieved the broadcaster's analytics reports.
codes.400:
- The start and end dates are optional but if you specify one, you must specify the other.
- The end date must be equal to or later than the start date.
- The cursor specified in the after query parameter is not valid.
- The resource supports only forward pagination (use the after query parameter).
- The first query parameter is outside the allowed range of values.
codes.401:
- The Authorization header is required and must contain a user access token.
- The user access token must include the analytics:read:extensions scope.
- The OAuth token is not valid.
- The Client-Id header is required.
- The client ID specified in the Client-Id header does not match the client ID specified in the OAuth token.
codes.404: - The extension specified in the extension_id query parameter was not found.

Get Extension Analytics.auth: Requires a [user access token](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/authentication#user-access-tokens) that includes the *analytics:read:extensions* scope.

Get Game Analytics.short: Gets an analytics report for one or more games.
Get Game Analytics.long: Gets an analytics report for one or more games. The response contains the URLs used to download the reports (CSV files). [Learn more](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/insights)

params.name: game_id
params.description: The game’s client ID. If specified, the response contains a report for the specified game. If not specified, the response includes a report for each of the authenticated user’s games.

params.name: type
params.description: The type of analytics report to get. Possible values are:- overview_v2

params.name: started_at
params.description: The reporting window’s start date, in RFC3339 format. Set the time portion to zeroes (for example, 2021-10-22T00:00:00Z). If you specify a start date, you must specify an end date.The start date must be within one year of today’s date. If you specify an earlier date, the API ignores it and uses a date that’s one year prior to today’s date. If you don’t specify a start and end date, the report includes all available data for the last 365 days from today.The report contains one row of data for each day in the reporting window.

params.name: ended_at
params.description: The reporting window’s end date, in RFC3339 format. Set the time portion to zeroes (for example, 2021-10-22T00:00:00Z). The report is inclusive of the end date.Specify an end date only if you provide a start date. Because it can take up to two days for the data to be available, you must specify an end date that’s earlier than today minus one to two days. If not, the API ignores your end date and uses an end date that is today minus one to two days.

params.name: first
params.description: The maximum number of report URLs to return per page in the response. The minimum page size is 1 URL per page and the maximum is 100 URLs per page. The default is 20.*NOTE*: While you may specify a maximum value of 100, the response will contain at most 20 URLs per page.

params.name: after
params.description: The cursor used to get the next page of results. The *Pagination* object in the response contains the cursor’s value. [Read More](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/api/guide#pagination)This parameter is ignored if game_id parameter is set.

reqBody.name: data
reqBody.description: A list of reports. The reports are returned in no particular order; however, the data within each report is in ascending order by date (newest first). The report contains one row of data per day of the reporting window; the report contains rows for only those days that the game was used. A report is available only if the game was broadcast for at least 5 hours over the reporting period. The array is empty if there are no reports.

reqBody.name: game_id
reqBody.description: An ID that identifies the game that the report was generated for.

reqBody.name: URL
reqBody.description: The URL that you use to download the report. The URL is valid for 5 minutes.

reqBody.name: type
reqBody.description: The type of report.

reqBody.name: date_range
reqBody.description: The reporting window’s start and end dates, in RFC3339 format.

reqBody.name: started_at
reqBody.description: The reporting window’s start date.

reqBody.name: ended_at
reqBody.description: The reporting window’s end date.

reqBody.name: pagination
reqBody.description: Contains the information used to page through the list of results. The object is empty if there are no more pages left to page through. [Read More](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/api/guide#pagination)

reqBody.name: cursor
reqBody.description: The cursor used to get the next page of results. Use the cursor to set the request’s after query parameter.

codes.200: Successfully retrieved the broadcaster’s analytics reports.
codes.400:
- The start and end dates are optional but if you specify one, you must specify the other.
- The end date must be equal to or later than the start date.
- The cursor specified in the after query parameter is not valid.
- The resource supports only forward pagination (use the after query parameter).
- The first query parameter is outside the allowed range of values.
codes.401:
- The Authorization header is required and must contain a user access token.
- The user access token must include the analytics:read:games scope.
- The OAuth token is not valid.
- The Client-Id header is required.
- The client ID specified in the Client-Id header does not match the client ID specified in the OAuth token.
codes.404: - The game specified in the game_id query parameter was not found.

Get Game Analytics.auth: Requires a [user access token](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/authentication#user-access-tokens) that includes the *analytics:read:games* scope.

Get Bits Leaderboard.short: Gets the Bits leaderboard for the authenticated broadcaster.
Get Bits Leaderboard.long: Gets the Bits leaderboard for the authenticated broadcaster.

params.name: count
params.description: The number of results to return. The minimum count is 1 and the maximum is 100. The default is 10.

params.name: period
params.description:
The time period over which data is aggregated (uses the PST time zone). Possible values are:- day — A day spans from 00:00:00 on the day specified in started_at and runs through 00:00:00 of the next day.
- week — A week spans from 00:00:00 on the Monday of the week specified in started_at and runs through 00:00:00 of the next Monday.
- month — A month spans from 00:00:00 on the first day of the month specified in started_at and runs through 00:00:00 of the first day of the next month.
- year — A year spans from 00:00:00 on the first day of the year specified in started_at and runs through 00:00:00 of the first day of the next year.
- all — Default. The lifetime of the broadcaster's channel.

params.name: started_at
params.description: The start date, in RFC3339 format, used for determining the aggregation period. Specify this parameter only if you specify the period query parameter. The start date is ignored if period is all.Note that the date is converted to PST before being used, so if you set the start time to `2022-01-01T00:00:00.0Z` and period to month, the actual reporting period is December 2021, not January 2022. If you want the reporting period to be January 2022, you must set the start time to `2022-01-01T08:00:00.0Z` or `2022-01-01T00:00:00.0-08:00`.If your start date uses the ‘+’ offset operator (for example, `2022-01-01T00:00:00.0+05:00`), you must URL encode the start date.

params.name: user_id
params.description: An ID that identifies a user that cheered bits in the channel. If count is greater than 1, the response may include users ranked above and below the specified user. To get the leaderboard’s top leaders, don’t specify a user ID.

reqBody.name: data
reqBody.description: A list of leaderboard leaders. The leaders are returned in rank order by how much they’ve cheered. The array is empty if nobody has cheered bits.

reqBody.name: user_id
reqBody.description: An ID that identifies a user on the leaderboard.

reqBody.name: user_login
reqBody.description: The user’s login name.

reqBody.name: user_name
reqBody.description: The user’s display name.

reqBody.name: rank
reqBody.description: The user’s position on the leaderboard.

reqBody.name: score
reqBody.description: The number of Bits the user has cheered.

reqBody.name: date_range
reqBody.description: The reporting window’s start and end dates, in RFC3339 format. The dates are calculated by using the started_at and period query parameters. If you don’t specify the started_at query parameter, the fields contain empty strings.

reqBody.name: started_at
reqBody.description: The reporting window’s start date.

reqBody.name: ended_at
reqBody.description: The reporting window’s end date.

reqBody.name: total
reqBody.description: The number of ranked users in `data`. This is the value in the count query parameter or the total number of entries on the leaderboard, whichever is less.

codes.200: Successfully retrieved the broadcaster’s Bits leaderboard.
codes.400:
- The time period specified in the period query parameter is not valid.
- The started_at query parameter is required if period is not set to all.
- The value in the count query parameter is outside the range of allowed values.
codes.401:
- The Authorization header is required and must specify a user access token.
- The user access token must include the the bits:read scope.
- The access token is not valid.
- The ID in the Client-Id header must match the client ID in the access token.

Get Bits Leaderboard.auth: Requires a [user access token](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/authentication#user-access-tokens) that includes the *bits:read* scope.

Get Cheermotes.short: Gets a list of Cheermotes that users can use to cheer Bits.
Get Cheermotes.long: Gets a list of Cheermotes that users can use to cheer Bits in any Bits-enabled channel’s chat room. Cheermotes are animated emotes that viewers can assign Bits to.

params.name: broadcaster_id
params.description: The ID of the broadcaster whose custom Cheermotes you want to get. Specify the broadcaster’s ID if you want to include the broadcaster’s Cheermotes in the response (not all broadcasters upload Cheermotes). If not specified, the response contains only global Cheermotes.If the broadcaster uploaded Cheermotes, the `type` field in the response is set to *channel_custom*.

reqBody.name: data
reqBody.description: The list of Cheermotes. The list is in ascending order by the `order` field’s value.

reqBody.name: prefix
reqBody.description: The name portion of the Cheermote string that you use in chat to cheer Bits. The full Cheermote string is the concatenation of {prefix} + {number of Bits}. For example, if the prefix is “Cheer” and you want to cheer 100 Bits, the full Cheermote string is Cheer100. When the Cheermote string is entered in chat, Twitch converts it to the image associated with the Bits tier that was cheered.

reqBody.name: tiers
reqBody.description: A list of tier levels that the Cheermote supports. Each tier identifies the range of Bits that you can cheer at that tier level and an image that graphically identifies the tier level.

reqBody.name: min_bits
reqBody.description: The minimum number of Bits that you must cheer at this tier level. The maximum number of Bits that you can cheer at this level is determined by the required minimum Bits of the next tier level minus 1. For example, if `min_bits` is 1 and `min_bits` for the next tier is 100, the Bits range for this tier level is 1 through 99. The minimum Bits value of the last tier is the maximum number of Bits you can cheer using this Cheermote. For example, 10000.

reqBody.name: id
reqBody.description:
The tier level. Possible tiers are:- 1
- 100
- 500
- 1000
- 5000
- 10000
- 100000

reqBody.name: color
reqBody.description: The hex code of the color associated with this tier level (for example, #979797).

reqBody.name: images
reqBody.description: The animated and static image sets for the Cheermote. The dictionary of images is organized by theme, format, and size. The theme keys are dark and light. Each theme is a dictionary of formats: animated and static. Each format is a dictionary of sizes: 1, 1.5, 2, 3, and 4. The value of each size contains the URL to the image.

reqBody.name: can_cheer
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that determines whether users can cheer at this tier level.

reqBody.name: show_in_bits_card
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that determines whether this tier level is shown in the Bits card. Is *true* if this tier level is shown in the Bits card.

reqBody.name: type
reqBody.description:
The type of Cheermote. Possible values are:- global_first_party — A Twitch-defined Cheermote that is shown in the Bits card.
- global_third_party — A Twitch-defined Cheermote that is not shown in the Bits card.
- channel_custom — A broadcaster-defined Cheermote.
- display_only — Do not use; for internal use only.
- sponsored — A sponsor-defined Cheermote. When used, the sponsor adds additional Bits to the amount that the user cheered. For example, if the user cheered Terminator100, the broadcaster might receive 110 Bits, which includes the sponsor's 10 Bits contribution.

reqBody.name: order
reqBody.description: The order that the Cheermotes are shown in the Bits card. The numbers may not be consecutive. For example, the numbers may jump from 1 to 7 to 13. The order numbers are unique within a Cheermote type (for example, global_first_party) but may not be unique amongst all Cheermotes in the response.

reqBody.name: last_updated
reqBody.description: The date and time, in RFC3339 format, when this Cheermote was last updated.

reqBody.name: is_charitable
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that indicates whether this Cheermote provides a charitable contribution match during charity campaigns.

codes.200: Successfully retrieved the Cheermotes.
codes.401:
- The Authorization header is required and must specify an app access token or user access token.
- The ID in the Client-Id header must match the Client ID in the OAuth token.

Get Extension Transactions.short: Gets an extension’s list of transactions.
Get Extension Transactions.long: Gets an extension’s list of transactions. A transaction records the exchange of a currency (for example, Bits) for a digital product.

params.name: extension_id
params.description: The ID of the extension whose list of transactions you want to get.

params.name: id
params.description: A transaction ID used to filter the list of transactions. Specify this parameter for each transaction you want to get. For example, `id=1234&id=5678`. You may specify a maximum of 100 IDs.

params.name: first
params.description: The maximum number of items to return per page in the response. The minimum page size is 1 item per page and the maximum is 100 items per page. The default is 20.

params.name: after
params.description: The cursor used to get the next page of results. The *Pagination* object in the response contains the cursor’s value. [Read More](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/api/guide#pagination)

reqBody.name: data
reqBody.description: The list of transactions.

reqBody.name: id
reqBody.description: An ID that identifies the transaction.

reqBody.name: timestamp
reqBody.description: The UTC date and time (in RFC3339 format) of the transaction.

reqBody.name: broadcaster_id
reqBody.description: The ID of the broadcaster that owns the channel where the transaction occurred.

reqBody.name: broadcaster_login
reqBody.description: The broadcaster’s login name.

reqBody.name: broadcaster_name
reqBody.description: The broadcaster’s display name.

reqBody.name: user_id
reqBody.description: The ID of the user that purchased the digital product.

reqBody.name: user_login
reqBody.description: The user’s login name.

reqBody.name: user_name
reqBody.description: The user’s display name.

reqBody.name: product_type
reqBody.description: The type of transaction. Possible values are:- BITS_IN_EXTENSION

reqBody.name: product_data
reqBody.description: Contains details about the digital product.

reqBody.name: sku
reqBody.description: An ID that identifies the digital product.

reqBody.name: domain
reqBody.description: Set to `twitch.ext.` + `<the extension's ID>`.

reqBody.name: cost
reqBody.description: Contains details about the digital product’s cost.

reqBody.name: amount
reqBody.description: The amount exchanged for the digital product.

reqBody.name: type
reqBody.description: The type of currency exchanged. Possible values are:- bits

reqBody.name: inDevelopment
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that determines whether the product is in development. Is *true* if the digital product is in development and cannot be exchanged.

reqBody.name: displayName
reqBody.description: The name of the digital product.

reqBody.name: expiration
reqBody.description: This field is always empty since you may purchase only unexpired products.

reqBody.name: broadcast
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that determines whether the data was broadcast to all instances of the extension. Is *true* if the data was broadcast to all instances.

reqBody.name: pagination
reqBody.description: Contains the information used to page through the list of results. The object is empty if there are no more pages left to page through. [Read More](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/api/guide#pagination)

reqBody.name: cursor
reqBody.description: The cursor used to get the next page of results. Use the cursor to set the request’s after query parameter.

codes.200: Successfully retrieved the list of transactions.
codes.400:
- The extension_id query parameter is required.
- The request specified too many id query parameters.
- The pagination cursor is not valid.
codes.401:
- The Authorization header is required and must specify an app access token.
- The access token is not valid.
- The ID in the extension_id query parameter must match the client ID in the access token.
- The ID in the Client-Id header must match the client ID in the access token.
codes.404: - One or more of the transaction IDs specified using the id query parameter were not found.

Get Channel Information.short: Gets information about one or more channels.
Get Channel Information.long: Gets information about one or more channels.

params.name: broadcaster_id
params.description: The ID of the broadcaster whose channel you want to get. To specify more than one ID, include this parameter for each broadcaster you want to get. For example, `broadcaster_id=1234&broadcaster_id=5678`. You may specify a maximum of 100 IDs. The API ignores duplicate IDs and IDs that are not found.

reqBody.name: data
reqBody.description: A list that contains information about the specified channels. The list is empty if the specified channels weren’t found.

reqBody.name: broadcaster_id
reqBody.description: An ID that uniquely identifies the broadcaster.

reqBody.name: broadcaster_login
reqBody.description: The broadcaster’s login name.

reqBody.name: broadcaster_name
reqBody.description: The broadcaster’s display name.

reqBody.name: broadcaster_language
reqBody.description: The broadcaster’s preferred language. The value is an ISO 639-1 two-letter language code (for example, en for English). The value is set to “other” if the language is not a Twitch supported language.

reqBody.name: game_name
reqBody.description: The name of the game that the broadcaster is playing or last played. The value is an empty string if the broadcaster has never played a game.

reqBody.name: game_id
reqBody.description: An ID that uniquely identifies the game that the broadcaster is playing or last played. The value is an empty string if the broadcaster has never played a game.

reqBody.name: title
reqBody.description: The title of the stream that the broadcaster is currently streaming or last streamed. The value is an empty string if the broadcaster has never streamed.

reqBody.name: delay
reqBody.description: The value of the broadcaster’s stream delay setting, in seconds. This field’s value defaults to zero unless 1) the request specifies a user access token, 2) the ID in the broadcaster_id query parameter matches the user ID in the access token, and 3) the broadcaster has partner status and they set a non-zero stream delay value.

reqBody.name: tags
reqBody.description: The tags applied to the channel.

reqBody.name: content_classification_labels
reqBody.description: The CCLs applied to the channel.

reqBody.name: is_branded_content
reqBody.description: Boolean flag indicating if the channel has branded content.

codes.200: Successfully retrieved the list of channels.
codes.400:
- The broadcaster_id query parameter is required.
- The broadcaster ID is not valid.
- The number of broadcaster_id query parameters exceeds the maximum allowed.
codes.401:
- The Authorization header is required and must specify an app access token or user access token.
- The OAuth token is not valid.
- The ID in the Client-Id header must match the Client ID in the OAuth token.
codes.429: - The application exceeded the number of calls it may make per minute. For details, see [Rate Limits](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/api/guide#twitch-rate-limits).

params.name: broadcaster_id
params.description: The ID of the broadcaster whose channel you want to update. This ID must match the user ID in the user access token.

reqBody.name: game_id
reqBody.description: The ID of the game that the user plays. The game is not updated if the ID isn’t a game ID that Twitch recognizes. To unset this field, use “0” or “” (an empty string).

reqBody.name: broadcaster_language
reqBody.description: The user’s preferred language. Set the value to an ISO 639-1 two-letter language code (for example, en for English). Set to “other” if the user’s preferred language is not a Twitch supported language. The language isn’t updated if the language code isn’t a Twitch supported language.

reqBody.name: title
reqBody.description: The title of the user’s stream. You may not set this field to an empty string.

reqBody.name: delay
reqBody.description: The number of seconds you want your broadcast buffered before streaming it live. The delay helps ensure fairness during competitive play. Only users with Partner status may set this field. The maximum delay is 900 seconds (15 minutes).

reqBody.name: tags
reqBody.description: A list of channel-defined tags to apply to the channel. To remove all tags from the channel, set tags to an empty array. Tags help identify the content that the channel streams. [Learn More](https://help.twitch.tv/s/article/guide-to-tags)A channel may specify a maximum of 10 tags. Each tag is limited to a maximum of 25 characters and may not be an empty string or contain spaces or special characters. Tags are case insensitive. For readability, consider using camelCasing or PascalCasing.

reqBody.name: content_classification_labels
reqBody.description: List of labels that should be set as the Channel’s CCLs.

reqBody.name: id
reqBody.description:
ID of the [Content Classification Labels](https://help.twitch.tv/s/article/content-classification-labels) that must be added/removed from the channel. Can be one of the following values:- DebatedSocialIssuesAndPolitics
- DrugsIntoxication
- SexualThemes
- ViolentGraphic
- Gambling
- ProfanityVulgarity

reqBody.name: is_enabled
reqBody.description: Boolean flag indicating whether the label should be enabled (true) or disabled for the channel.

reqBody.name: is_branded_content
reqBody.description: Boolean flag indicating if the channel has branded content.

codes.400:
- The broadcaster_id query parameter is required.
- The request must update at least one property.
- The `title` field may not contain an empty string.
- The ID in `game_id` is not valid.
- To update the `delay` field, the broadcaster must have partner status.
- The list in the `tags` field exceeds the maximum number of tags allowed.
- A tag in the `tags` field exceeds the maximum length allowed.
- A tag in the `tags` field is empty.
- A tag in the `tags` field contains special characters or spaces.
- One or more tags in the `tags` field failed AutoMod review.
- Game restricted for user's age and region
codes.401:
- User requests CCL for a channel they don’t own
- The ID in broadcaster_id must match the user ID found in the OAuth token.
- The Authorization header is required and must specify a user access token.
- The OAuth token must include the channel:manage:broadcast scope.
- The OAuth token is not valid.
- The ID in the Client-Id header must match the Client ID in the OAuth token.
codes.403:
- User requested gaming CCLs to be added to their channel
- Unallowed CCLs declared for underaged authorized user in a restricted country
codes.409: User set the Branded Content flag too frequently

Get Channel Editors.auth: Requires a [user access token](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/authentication#user-access-tokens) that includes the *channel:read:editors* scope.

Get Followed Channels.short: Gets a list of broadcasters that the specified user follows. You can also use this endpoint to see whether a user follows a specific broadcaster.
Get Followed Channels.long: Gets a list of broadcasters that the specified user follows. You can also use this endpoint to see whether a user follows a specific broadcaster.

params.name: user_id
params.description: A user’s ID. Returns the list of broadcasters that this user follows. This ID must match the user ID in the user OAuth token.

params.name: broadcaster_id
params.description: A broadcaster’s ID. Use this parameter to see whether the user follows this broadcaster. If specified, the response contains this broadcaster if the user follows them. If not specified, the response contains all broadcasters that the user follows.

params.name: first
params.description: The maximum number of items to return per page in the response. The minimum page size is 1 item per page and the maximum is 100. The default is 20.

params.name: after
params.description: The cursor used to get the next page of results. The *Pagination* object in the response contains the cursor’s value. [Read more](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/api/guide#pagination).

reqBody.name: data
reqBody.description: The list of broadcasters that the user follows. The list is in descending order by `followed_at` (with the most recently followed broadcaster first). The list is empty if the user doesn’t follow anyone.

reqBody.name: broadcaster_id
reqBody.description: An ID that uniquely identifies the broadcaster that this user is following.

reqBody.name: broadcaster_login
reqBody.description: The broadcaster’s login name.

reqBody.name: broadcaster_name
reqBody.description: The broadcaster’s display name.

reqBody.name: followed_at
reqBody.description: The UTC timestamp when the user started following the broadcaster.

reqBody.name: pagination
reqBody.description: Contains the information used to page through the list of results. The object is empty if there are no more pages left to page through. [Read more](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/api/guide#pagination).

reqBody.name: cursor
reqBody.description: The cursor used to get the next page of results. Use the cursor to set the request’s after query parameter.

reqBody.name: total
reqBody.description: The total number of broadcasters that the user follows. As someone pages through the list, the number may change as the user follows or unfollows broadcasters.

codes.200: Successfully retrieved the broadcaster's list of followers.
codes.400:
Possible reasons:- The user_id query parameter is required.
- The broadcaster_id query parameter is not valid.
- The user_id query parameter is required.
codes.401:
Possible reasons:- The ID in the user_id query parameter must match the user ID in the access token.
- The Authorization header is required and must contain a user access token.
- The user access token is missing the user:read:follows scope.
- The OAuth token is not valid.
- The client ID specified in the Client-Id header does not match the client ID specified in the OAuth token.

Get Followed Channels.auth: Requires a [user access token](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/authentication#user-access-tokens) that includes the *user:read:follows* scope.

Get Channel Followers.short: Gets a list of users that follow the specified broadcaster. You can also use this endpoint to see whether a specific user follows the broadcaster.
Get Channel Followers.long: Gets a list of users that follow the specified broadcaster. You can also use this endpoint to see whether a specific user follows the broadcaster.
Get Channel Followers.auth:
- Requires a [user access token](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/authentication#user-access-tokens) that includes the *moderator:read:followers* scope.
- The ID in the broadcaster_id query parameter must match the user ID in the access token or the user ID in the access token must be a moderator for the specified broadcaster.

Create Custom Rewards.short: Creates a Custom Reward in the broadcaster’s channel.
Create Custom Rewards.long: Creates a Custom Reward in the broadcaster’s channel. The maximum number of custom rewards per channel is 50, which includes both enabled and disabled rewards.

params.name: broadcaster_id
params.description: The ID of the broadcaster to add the custom reward to. This ID must match the user ID found in the OAuth token.

reqBody.name: title
reqBody.description: The custom reward’s title. The title may contain a maximum of 45 characters and it must be unique amongst all of the broadcaster’s custom rewards.

reqBody.name: cost
reqBody.description: The cost of the reward, in Channel Points. The minimum is 1 point.

reqBody.name: prompt
reqBody.description: The prompt shown to the viewer when they redeem the reward. Specify a prompt if `is_user_input_required` is *true*. The prompt is limited to a maximum of 200 characters.

reqBody.name: is_enabled
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that determines whether the reward is enabled. Viewers see only enabled rewards. The default is *true*.

reqBody.name: background_color
reqBody.description: The background color to use for the reward. Specify the color using Hex format (for example, #9147FF).

reqBody.name: is_user_input_required
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that determines whether the user needs to enter information when redeeming the reward. See the `prompt` field. The default is *false*.

reqBody.name: is_max_per_stream_enabled
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that determines whether to limit the maximum number of redemptions allowed per live stream (see the `max_per_stream` field). The default is *false*.

reqBody.name: max_per_stream
reqBody.description: The maximum number of redemptions allowed per live stream. Applied only if `is_max_per_stream_enabled` is *true*. The minimum value is 1.

reqBody.name: is_max_per_user_per_stream_enabled
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that determines whether to limit the maximum number of redemptions allowed per user per stream (see the `max_per_user_per_stream` field). The default is *false*.

reqBody.name: max_per_user_per_stream
reqBody.description: The maximum number of redemptions allowed per user per stream. Applied only if `is_max_per_user_per_stream_enabled` is *true*. The minimum value is 1.

reqBody.name: is_global_cooldown_enabled
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that determines whether to apply a cooldown period between redemptions (see the `global_cooldown_seconds` field for the duration of the cooldown period). The default is *false*.

reqBody.name: global_cooldown_seconds
reqBody.description: The cooldown period, in seconds. Applied only if the `is_global_cooldown_enabled` field is *true*. The minimum value is 1; however, the minimum value is 60 for it to be shown in the Twitch UX.

reqBody.name: should_redemptions_skip_request_queue
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that determines whether redemptions should be set to FULFILLED status immediately when a reward is redeemed. If *false*, status is set to UNFULFILLED and follows the normal request queue process. The default is *false*.

reqBody.name: data
reqBody.description: A list that contains the single custom reward you created.

reqBody.name: broadcaster_id
reqBody.description: The ID that uniquely identifies the broadcaster.

reqBody.name: broadcaster_login
reqBody.description: The broadcaster’s login name.

reqBody.name: broadcaster_name
reqBody.description: The broadcaster’s display name.

reqBody.name: id
reqBody.description: The ID that uniquely identifies this custom reward.

reqBody.name: title
reqBody.description: The title of the reward.

reqBody.name: prompt
reqBody.description: The prompt shown to the viewer when they redeem the reward if user input is required (see the `is_user_input_required` field).

reqBody.name: cost
reqBody.description: The cost of the reward in Channel Points.

reqBody.name: image
reqBody.description: A set of custom images for the reward. This field is set to *null* if the broadcaster didn’t upload images.

reqBody.name: url_1x
reqBody.description: The URL to a small version of the image.

reqBody.name: url_2x
reqBody.description: The URL to a medium version of the image.

reqBody.name: url_4x
reqBody.description: The URL to a large version of the image.

reqBody.name: default_image
reqBody.description: A set of default images for the reward.

reqBody.name: url_1x
reqBody.description: The URL to a small version of the image.

reqBody.name: url_2x
reqBody.description: The URL to a medium version of the image.

reqBody.name: url_4x
reqBody.description: The URL to a large version of the image.

reqBody.name: background_color
reqBody.description: The background color to use for the reward. The color is in Hex format (for example, #00E5CB).

reqBody.name: is_enabled
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that determines whether the reward is enabled. Is *true* if enabled; otherwise, *false*. Disabled rewards aren’t shown to the user.

reqBody.name: is_user_input_required
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that determines whether the user must enter information when redeeming the reward. Is *true* if the reward requires user input.

reqBody.name: max_per_stream_setting
reqBody.description: The settings used to determine whether to apply a maximum to the number to the redemptions allowed per live stream.

reqBody.name: is_enabled
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that determines whether the reward applies a limit on the number of redemptions allowed per live stream. Is *true* if the reward applies a limit.

reqBody.name: max_per_stream
reqBody.description: The maximum number of redemptions allowed per live stream.

reqBody.name: max_per_user_per_stream_setting
reqBody.description: The settings used to determine whether to apply a maximum to the number of redemptions allowed per user per live stream.

reqBody.name: is_enabled
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that determines whether the reward applies a limit on the number of redemptions allowed per user per live stream. Is *true* if the reward applies a limit.

reqBody.name: max_per_user_per_stream
reqBody.description: The maximum number of redemptions allowed per user per live stream.

reqBody.name: global_cooldown_setting
reqBody.description: The settings used to determine whether to apply a cooldown period between redemptions and the length of the cooldown.

reqBody.name: is_enabled
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that determines whether to apply a cooldown period. Is *true* if a cooldown period is enabled.

reqBody.name: global_cooldown_seconds
reqBody.description: The cooldown period, in seconds.

reqBody.name: is_paused
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that determines whether the reward is currently paused. Is *true* if the reward is paused. Viewers can’t redeem paused rewards.

reqBody.name: is_in_stock
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that determines whether the reward is currently in stock. Is *true* if the reward is in stock. Viewers can’t redeem out of stock rewards.

reqBody.name: should_redemptions_skip_request_queue
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that determines whether redemptions should be set to FULFILLED status immediately when a reward is redeemed. If *false*, status is UNFULFILLED and follows the normal request queue process.

reqBody.name: redemptions_redeemed_current_stream
reqBody.description: The number of redemptions redeemed during the current live stream. The number counts against the `max_per_stream_setting` limit. This field is *null* if the broadcaster’s stream isn’t live or max_per_stream_setting isn’t enabled.

reqBody.name: cooldown_expires_at
reqBody.description: The timestamp of when the cooldown period expires. Is *null* if the reward isn’t in a cooldown state (see the `global_cooldown_setting` field).

codes.200: Successfully created the custom reward.
codes.400:
- The request exceeds the maximum number of rewards allowed per channel.
- The broadcaster_id query parameter is required.
- The `title` field is required.
- The `title` must contain a minimum of 1 character and a maximum of 45 characters.
- The `title` must be unique amongst all of the broadcaster's custom rewards.
- The `cost` field is required.
- The `cost` field must contain a minimum of 1 point.
- The `prompt` field is limited to a maximum of 200 characters.
- If `is_max_per_stream_enabled` is true, the minimum value for `max_per_stream` is 1.
- If `is_max_per_user_per_stream_enabled` is true, the minimum value for `max_per_user_per_stream` is 1.
- If `is_global_cooldown_enabled` is true, the minimum value for `global_cooldown_seconds` is 1.

params.name: broadcaster_id

- FULFILLED
- UNFULFILLED

You may specify a maximum of 50 IDs.Duplicate IDs are ignored. The response contains only the IDs that were found. If none of the IDs were found, the response is 404 Not Found.

reqBody.description: The reward’s title.

reqBody.name: prompt
reqBody.description: The prompt displayed to the viewer if user input is required.

reqBody.name: cost
reqBody.description: The reward’s cost, in Channel Points.

codes.200: Successfully retrieved the list of redeemed custom rewards.
codes.400:
- The broadcaster_id query parameter is required.
- The reward_id query parameter is required.
- The status query parameter is required if you didn't specify the id query parameter.
- The value in the status query parameter is not valid.
- The value in the sort query parameter is not valid.
codes.401:
- The Authorization header is required and must specify a user access token.
- The user access token must include the channel:read:redemptions scope.
- The OAuth token is not valid.
- The ID in the Client-Id header must match the Client ID in the OAuth token.
codes.403:
- The ID in the Client-Id header must match the client ID used to create the custom reward.
- The broadcaster is not a partner or affiliate.
codes.404: - All of the redemptions specified using the id query parameter were not found.

Get Custom Reward Redemption.auth: Requires a [user access token](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/authentication#user-access-tokens) that includes the *channel:read:redemptions* or *channel:manage:redemptions* scope.

Update Custom Reward.long: Updates a custom reward. The app used to create the reward is the only app that may update the reward.

params.name: broadcaster_id
params.description: The ID of the broadcaster that’s updating the reward. This ID must match the user ID found in the OAuth token.

params.name: id
params.description: The ID of the reward to update.

reqBody.name: title
reqBody.description: The reward’s title. The title may contain a maximum of 45 characters and it must be unique amongst all of the broadcaster’s custom rewards.

reqBody.name: prompt
reqBody.description: The prompt shown to the viewer when they redeem the reward. Specify a prompt if `is_user_input_required` is *true*. The prompt is limited to a maximum of 200 characters.

reqBody.name: cost
reqBody.description: The cost of the reward, in channel points. The minimum is 1 point.

reqBody.name: background_color
reqBody.description: The background color to use for the reward. Specify the color using Hex format (for example, \#00E5CB).

reqBody.name: is_enabled
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that indicates whether the reward is enabled. Set to *true* to enable the reward. Viewers see only enabled rewards.

reqBody.name: is_user_input_required
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that determines whether users must enter information to redeem the reward. Set to *true* if user input is required. See the `prompt` field.

reqBody.name: is_max_per_stream_enabled
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that determines whether to limit the maximum number of redemptions allowed per live stream (see the `max_per_stream` field). Set to *true* to limit redemptions.

reqBody.name: max_per_stream
reqBody.description: The maximum number of redemptions allowed per live stream. Applied only if `is_max_per_stream_enabled` is *true*. The minimum value is 1.

reqBody.name: is_max_per_user_per_stream_enabled
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that determines whether to limit the maximum number of redemptions allowed per user per stream (see `max_per_user_per_stream`). The minimum value is 1. Set to *true* to limit redemptions.

reqBody.name: max_per_user_per_stream
reqBody.description: The maximum number of redemptions allowed per user per stream. Applied only if `is_max_per_user_per_stream_enabled` is *true*.

reqBody.name: is_global_cooldown_enabled
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that determines whether to apply a cooldown period between redemptions. Set to *true* to apply a cooldown period. For the duration of the cooldown period, see `global_cooldown_seconds`.

reqBody.name: global_cooldown_seconds
reqBody.description: The cooldown period, in seconds. Applied only if `is_global_cooldown_enabled` is *true*. The minimum value is 1; however, for it to be shown in the Twitch UX, the minimum value is 60.

reqBody.name: is_paused
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that determines whether to pause the reward. Set to *true* to pause the reward. Viewers can’t redeem paused rewards..

reqBody.name: should_redemptions_skip_request_queue
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that determines whether redemptions should be set to FULFILLED status immediately when a reward is redeemed. If *false*, status is set to UNFULFILLED and follows the normal request queue process.

reqBody.name: data
reqBody.description: The list contains the single reward that you updated.

reqBody.name: broadcaster_id
reqBody.description: The ID that uniquely identifies the broadcaster.

reqBody.name: broadcaster_login
reqBody.description: The broadcaster’s login name.

reqBody.name: broadcaster_name
reqBody.description: The broadcaster’s display name.

reqBody.name: id
reqBody.description: The ID that uniquely identifies this custom reward.

reqBody.name: title
reqBody.description: The title of the reward.

reqBody.name: prompt
reqBody.description: The prompt shown to the viewer when they redeem the reward if user input is required. See the `is_user_input_required` field.

reqBody.name: cost
reqBody.description: The cost of the reward in Channel Points.

reqBody.name: image
reqBody.description: A set of custom images for the reward. This field is *null* if the broadcaster didn’t upload images.

reqBody.name: url_1x
reqBody.description: The URL to a small version of the image.

reqBody.name: url_2x
reqBody.description: The URL to a medium version of the image.

reqBody.name: url_4x
reqBody.description: The URL to a large version of the image.

reqBody.name: default_image
reqBody.description: A set of default images for the reward.

reqBody.name: url_1x
reqBody.description: The URL to a small version of the image.

reqBody.name: url_2x
reqBody.description: The URL to a medium version of the image.

reqBody.name: url_4x
reqBody.description: The URL to a large version of the image.

reqBody.name: background_color
reqBody.description: The background color to use for the reward. The color is in Hex format (for example, #00E5CB).

reqBody.name: is_enabled
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that determines whether the reward is enabled. Is *true* if enabled; otherwise, *false*. Disabled rewards aren’t shown to the user.

reqBody.name: is_user_input_required
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that determines whether the user must enter information when they redeem the reward. Is *true* if the user is prompted.

reqBody.name: max_per_stream_setting
reqBody.description: The settings used to determine whether to apply a maximum to the number of redemptions allowed per live stream.

reqBody.name: is_enabled
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that determines whether the reward applies a limit on the number of redemptions allowed per live stream. Is *true* if the reward applies a limit.

reqBody.name: max_per_stream
reqBody.description: The maximum number of redemptions allowed per live stream.

reqBody.name: max_per_user_per_stream_setting
reqBody.description: The settings used to determine whether to apply a maximum to the number of redemptions allowed per user per live stream.

reqBody.name: is_enabled
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that determines whether the reward applies a limit on the number of redemptions allowed per user per live stream. Is *true* if the reward applies a limit.

reqBody.name: max_per_user_per_stream
reqBody.description: The maximum number of redemptions allowed per user per live stream.

reqBody.name: global_cooldown_setting
reqBody.description: The settings used to determine whether to apply a cooldown period between redemptions and the length of the cooldown.

reqBody.name: is_enabled
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that determines whether to apply a cooldown period. Is *true* if a cooldown period is enabled.

reqBody.name: global_cooldown_seconds
reqBody.description: The cooldown period, in seconds.

reqBody.name: is_paused
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that determines whether the reward is currently paused. Is *true* if the reward is paused. Viewers can’t redeem paused rewards.

reqBody.name: is_in_stock
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that determines whether the reward is currently in stock. Is *true* if the reward is in stock. Viewers can’t redeem out of stock rewards.

reqBody.name: should_redemptions_skip_request_queue
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that determines whether redemptions should be set to FULFILLED status immediately when a reward is redeemed. If *false*, status is set to UNFULFILLED and follows the normal request queue process.

reqBody.name: redemptions_redeemed_current_stream
reqBody.description: The number of redemptions redeemed during the current live stream. The number counts against the `max_per_stream_setting` limit. This field is *null* if the broadcaster’s stream isn’t live or max_per_stream_setting isn’t enabled.

reqBody.name: cooldown_expires_at
reqBody.description: The timestamp of when the cooldown period expires. Is *null* if the reward isn’t in a cooldown state. See the `global_cooldown_setting` field.

codes.200: Successfully updated the custom reward.
codes.400:
ul>- The broadcaster_id query parameter is required.
- The id query parameter is required.
- The `title` must contain a minimum of 1 character and a maximum of 45 characters.
- The `title` must be unique amongst all of the broadcaster's custom rewards.
- The `cost` field must contain a minimum of 1 point.
- The `prompt` field is limited to a maximum of 200 characters.
- If `is_max_per_stream_enabled` is true, the minimum value for `max_per_stream` is 1.
- If `is_max_per_user_per_stream_enabled` is true, the minimum value for `max_per_user_per_stream` is 1.
- If `is_global_cooldown_enabled` is true, the minimum value for `global_cooldown_seconds` is 1 and the maximum is 604800.
codes.401:
- The Authorization header is required and must specify a user access token.
- The user access token must include the channel:manage:redemptions scope.
- The OAuth token is not valide.
- The ID in the Client-Id header must match the Client ID in the OAuth token.
codes.403:
- The ID in the Client-Id header must match the client ID used to create the custom reward.
- The broadcaster is not a partner or affiliate.
codes.404: - The custom reward specified in the id query parameter was not found.

Update Custom Reward.auth: Requires a [user access token](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/api/authentication#user-access-tokens) that includes the *channel:manage:redemptions* scope.
Update Custom Reward.reqBodyInfo: The body of the request should contain only the fields you’re updating.

Update Redemption Status.long: Updates a redemption’s status. You may update a redemption only if its status is UNFULFILLED. The app used to create the reward is the only app that may update the redemption.

params.name: id
params.description: A list of IDs that identify the redemptions to update. To specify more than one ID, include this parameter for each redemption you want to update. For example, `id=1234&id=5678`. You may specify a maximum of 50 IDs.

params.name: broadcaster_id
params.description: The ID of the broadcaster that’s updating the redemption. This ID must match the user ID in the user access token.

params.name: reward_id
params.description: The ID that identifies the reward that’s been redeemed.

reqBody.name: status
reqBody.description:
The status to set the redemption to. Possible values are:- CANCELED
- FULFILLED
Setting the status to CANCELED refunds the user’s channel points.

reqBody.name: data
reqBody.description: The list contains the single redemption that you updated.

reqBody.name: broadcaster_id
reqBody.description: The ID that uniquely identifies the broadcaster.

reqBody.name: broadcaster_login
reqBody.description: The broadcaster’s login name.

reqBody.name: broadcaster_name
reqBody.description: The broadcaster’s display name.

reqBody.name: id
reqBody.description: The ID that uniquely identifies this redemption..

reqBody.name: user_id
reqBody.description: The ID of the user that redeemed the reward.

reqBody.name: user_name
reqBody.description: The user’s display name.

reqBody.name: user_login
reqBody.description: The user’s login name.

reqBody.name: reward
reqBody.description: An object that describes the reward that the user redeemed.

reqBody.name: id
reqBody.description: The ID that uniquely identifies the reward.

reqBody.name: title
reqBody.description: The reward’s title.

reqBody.name: prompt
reqBody.description: The prompt displayed to the viewer if user input is required.

reqBody.name: cost
reqBody.description: The reward’s cost, in Channel Points.

reqBody.name: user_input
reqBody.description: The text that the user entered at the prompt when they redeemed the reward; otherwise, an empty string if user input was not required.

reqBody.name: status
reqBody.description:
The state of the redemption. Possible values are:- CANCELED
- FULFILLED
- UNFULFILLED

reqBody.name: redeemed_at
reqBody.description: The date and time of when the reward was redeemed, in RFC3339 format.

codes.200: Successfully updated the redemption’s status.
codes.400:
- The broadcaster_id query parameter is required.
- The reward_id query parameter is required.
- The id query parameter is required.
- The value in the status query parameter is not valid.
codes.401:
- The Authorization header is required and must specify a user access token.
- The user access token must include the channel:manage:redemptions scope.
- The OAuth token is not valid.
- The ID in the Client-Id header must match the Client ID in the OAuth token.
codes.403:
- The ID in the Client-Id header must match the client ID used to create the custom reward.

Get Charity Campaign.short: Gets information about the broadcaster’s active charity campaign.
Get Charity Campaign.long:
Gets information about the charity campaign that a broadcaster is running. For example, the campaign’s fundraising goal and the current amount of donations.
To receive events when progress is made towards the campaign’s goal or the broadcaster changes the fundraising goal, subscribe to the [channel.charity_campaign.progress](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/eventsub/eventsub-subscription-types#channelcharity_campaignprogress) subscription type.

params.name: broadcaster_id
params.description: The ID of the broadcaster that’s currently running a charity campaign. This ID must match the user ID in the access token.

reqBody.name: data
reqBody.description: A list that contains the charity campaign that the broadcaster is currently running. The list is empty if the broadcaster is not running a charity campaign; the campaign information is not available after the campaign ends.

reqBody.name: id
reqBody.description: An ID that identifies the charity campaign.

reqBody.name: broadcaster_id
reqBody.description: An ID that identifies the broadcaster that’s running the campaign.

reqBody.name: broadcaster_login
reqBody.description: The broadcaster’s login name.

reqBody.name: broadcaster_name
reqBody.description: The broadcaster’s display name.

reqBody.name: charity_name
reqBody.description: The charity’s name.

reqBody.name: charity_description
reqBody.description: A description of the charity.

reqBody.name: charity_logo
reqBody.description: A URL to an image of the charity’s logo. The image’s type is PNG and its size is 100px X 100px.

reqBody.name: charity_website
reqBody.description: A URL to the charity’s website.

reqBody.name: current_amount
reqBody.description: The current amount of donations that the campaign has received.

reqBody.name: value
reqBody.description: The monetary amount. The amount is specified in the currency’s minor unit. For example, the minor units for USD is cents, so if the amount is $5.50 USD, `value` is set to 550.

reqBody.name: decimal_places
reqBody.description: The number of decimal places used by the currency. For example, USD uses two decimal places. Use this number to translate `value` from minor units to major units by using the formula:`value / 10^decimal_places`

reqBody.name: currency
reqBody.description: The ISO-4217 three-letter currency code that identifies the type of currency in `value`.

reqBody.name: target_amount
reqBody.description: The campaign’s fundraising goal. This field is *null* if the broadcaster has not defined a fundraising goal.

reqBody.name: value
reqBody.description: The monetary amount. The amount is specified in the currency’s minor unit. For example, the minor units for USD is cents, so if the amount is $5.50 USD, `value` is set to 550.

reqBody.name: decimal_places
reqBody.description: The number of decimal places used by the currency. For example, USD uses two decimal places. Use this number to translate `value` from minor units to major units by using the formula:`value / 10^decimal_places`

reqBody.name: currency
reqBody.description: The ISO-4217 three-letter currency code that identifies the type of currency in `value`.

codes.200: Successfully retrieved information about the broadcaster’s active charity campaign.
codes.400:
- The broadcaster_id query parameter is required.
- The broadcaster_id query parameter is not valid.
codes.401:
- The ID in the broadcaster_id query parameter must match the user ID in the access token.
- The Authorization header is required and must contain a user access token.
- The user access token must include the channel:read:charity scope.
- The access token is not valid.
- The client ID specified in the Client-Id header must match the client ID specified in the access token.
codes.403: - The broadcaster is not a partner or affiliate.

Get Charity Campaign Donations.long:
Gets the list of donations that users have made to the broadcaster’s active charity campaign.
To receive events as donations occur, subscribe to the [channel.charity_campaign.donate](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/eventsub/eventsub-subscription-types#channelcharity_campaigndonate) subscription type.

params.name: broadcaster_id
params.description: The ID of the broadcaster that’s currently running a charity campaign. This ID must match the user ID in the access token.

params.name: first
params.description: The maximum number of items to return per page in the response. The minimum page size is 1 item per page and the maximum is 100. The default is 20.

params.name: after
params.description: The cursor used to get the next page of results. The *Pagination* object in the response contains the cursor’s value. [Read More](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/api/guide#pagination)

reqBody.name: data
reqBody.description: A list that contains the donations that users have made to the broadcaster’s charity campaign. The list is empty if the broadcaster is not currently running a charity campaign; the donation information is not available after the campaign ends.

reqBody.name: id
reqBody.description: An ID that identifies the donation. The ID is unique across campaigns.

reqBody.name: campaign_id
reqBody.description: An ID that identifies the charity campaign that the donation applies to.

reqBody.name: user_id
reqBody.description: An ID that identifies a user that donated money to the campaign.

reqBody.name: user_login
reqBody.description: The user’s login name.

reqBody.name: user_name

reqBody.name: amount
reqBody.description: An object that contains the amount of money that the user donated.

reqBody.name: value
reqBody.description: The monetary amount. The amount is specified in the currency’s minor unit. For example, the minor units for USD is cents, so if the amount is $5.50 USD, `value` is set to 550.

reqBody.name: decimal_places
reqBody.description: The number of decimal places used by the currency. For example, USD uses two decimal places. Use this number to translate `value` from minor units to major units by using the formula:`value / 10^decimal_places`

reqBody.name: currency
reqBody.description: The ISO-4217 three-letter currency code that identifies the type of currency in `value`.

reqBody.name: pagination
reqBody.description: An object that contains the information used to page through the list of results. The object is empty if there are no more pages left to page through. [Read More](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/api/guide#pagination)

reqBody.name: cursor
reqBody.description: The cursor used to get the next page of results. Use the cursor to set the request’s after query parameter.

codes.200: Successfully retrieved the list of donations that users contributed to the broadcaster’s charity campaign.
codes.400:
