Get Chatters.short: Gets the list of users that are connected to the broadcaster’s chat session.
Get Chatters.long:
Gets the list of users that are connected to the broadcaster’s chat session.
*NOTE*: There is a delay between when users join and leave a chat and when the list is updated accordingly.
To determine whether a user is a moderator or VIP, use the [Get Moderators](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/api/reference#get-moderators) and [Get VIPs](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/api/reference#get-vips) endpoints. You can check the roles of up to 100 users.

params.name: broadcaster_id
params.description: The ID of the broadcaster whose list of chatters you want to get.

params.name: moderator_id
params.description: The ID of the broadcaster or one of the broadcaster’s moderators. This ID must match the user ID in the user access token.

params.name: first
params.description: The maximum number of items to return per page in the response. The minimum page size is 1 item per page and the maximum is 1,000. The default is 100.

params.name: after
params.description: The cursor used to get the next page of results. The *Pagination* object in the response contains the cursor’s value. [Read More](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/api/guide#pagination)

reqBody.name: data
reqBody.description: The list of users that are connected to the broadcaster’s chat room. The list is empty if no users are connected to the chat room.

reqBody.name: user_id
reqBody.description: The ID of a user that’s connected to the broadcaster’s chat room.

reqBody.name: user_login
reqBody.description: The user’s login name.

reqBody.name: user_name
reqBody.description: The user’s display name.

reqBody.name: pagination
reqBody.description: Contains the information used to page through the list of results. The object is empty if there are no more pages left to page through. [Read More](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/api/guide#pagination)

reqBody.name: cursor
reqBody.description: The cursor used to get the next page of results. Use the cursor to set the request’s after query parameter.

reqBody.name: total
reqBody.description: The total number of users that are connected to the broadcaster’s chat room. As you page through the list, the number of users may change as users join and leave the chat room.

codes.200: Successfully retrieved the broadcaster’s list of chatters.
codes.400:
- The broadcaster_id query parameter is required.
- The ID in the broadcaster_id query parameter is not valid.
- The moderator_id query parameter is required.
- The ID in the moderator_id query parameter is not valid.
codes.401:
- The ID in the moderator_id query parameter must match the user ID in the access token.
- The Authorization header is required and must contain a user access token.
- The user access token must include the moderator:read:chatters scope.
- The access token is not valid.
- The client ID specified in the Client-Id header does not match the client ID specified in the access token.
codes.403: - The user in the moderator_id query parameter is not one of the broadcaster's moderators.

Get Chatters.auth: Requires a [user access token](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/authentication#user-access-tokens) that includes the *moderator:read:chatters* scope.

Get Channel Emotes.short: Gets the broadcaster’s list of custom emotes.
Get Channel Emotes.long:
Gets the broadcaster’s list of custom emotes. Broadcasters create these custom emotes for users who subscribe to or follow the channel or cheer Bits in the channel’s chat window. [Learn More](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/irc/emotes)
For information about the custom emotes, see [subscriber emotes](https://help.twitch.tv/s/article/subscriber-emote-guide), [Bits tier emotes](https://help.twitch.tv/s/article/custom-bit-badges-guide?language=bg#slots), and [follower emotes](https://blog.twitch.tv/en/2021/06/04/kicking-off-10-years-with-our-biggest-emote-update-ever/).
*NOTE:* With the exception of custom follower emotes, users may use custom emotes in any Twitch chat.

params.name: broadcaster_id
params.description: An ID that identifies the broadcaster whose emotes you want to get.

reqBody.name: data
reqBody.description: The list of emotes that the specified broadcaster created. If the broadcaster hasn't created custom emotes, the list is empty.

reqBody.name: id
reqBody.description: An ID that identifies this emote.

reqBody.name: name
reqBody.description: The name of the emote. This is the name that viewers type in the chat window to get the emote to appear.

reqBody.name: images
reqBody.description: The image URLs for the emote. These image URLs always provide a static, non-animated emote image with a light background.*NOTE:* You should use the templated URL in the `template` field to fetch the image instead of using these URLs.

reqBody.name: url_1x
reqBody.description: A URL to the small version (28px x 28px) of the emote.

reqBody.name: url_2x
reqBody.description: A URL to the medium version (56px x 56px) of the emote.

reqBody.name: url_4x
reqBody.description: A URL to the large version (112px x 112px) of the emote.

reqBody.name: tier
reqBody.description: The subscriber tier at which the emote is unlocked. This field contains the tier information only if `emote_type` is set to `subscriptions`, otherwise, it's an empty string.

reqBody.name: emote_type
reqBody.description:
The type of emote. The possible values are:- bitstier — A custom Bits tier emote.
- follower — A custom follower emote.
- subscriptions — A custom subscriber emote.

reqBody.name: emote_set_id
reqBody.description: An ID that identifies the emote set that the emote belongs to.

reqBody.name: format
reqBody.description:
The formats that the emote is available in. For example, if the emote is available only as a static PNG, the array contains only `static`. But if the emote is available as a static PNG and an animated GIF, the array contains `static` and `animated`. The possible formats are:- animated — An animated GIF is available for this emote.
- static — A static PNG file is available for this emote.

reqBody.name: scale
reqBody.description:
The sizes that the emote is available in. For example, if the emote is available in small and medium sizes, the array contains 1.0 and 2.0. Possible sizes are:- 1.0 — A small version (28px x 28px) is available.
- 2.0 — A medium version (56px x 56px) is available.
- 3.0 — A large version (112px x 112px) is available.

reqBody.name: theme_mode
reqBody.description:
The background themes that the emote is available in. Possible themes are:- dark
- light

reqBody.name: template
reqBody.description: A templated URL. Use the values from the `id`, `format`, `scale`, and `theme_mode` fields to replace the like-named placeholder strings in the templated URL to create a CDN (content delivery network) URL that you use to fetch the emote. For information about what the template looks like and how to use it to fetch emotes, see [Emote CDN URL format](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/irc/emotes#cdn-template). You should use this template instead of using the URLs in the `images` object.

codes.200: Successfully retrieved broadcaster's list of custom emotes.
codes.400: - The broadcaster_id query parameter is required.
codes.401:
- The Authorization header is required and must specify a valid app access token or user access token.
- The OAuth token is not valid.
- The ID in the Client-Id header must match the Client ID in the OAuth token.

Get Global Emotes.long:
Gets the list of [global emotes](https://www.twitch.tv/creatorcamp/en/learn-the-basics/emotes/). Global emotes are Twitch-created emotes that users can use in any Twitch chat.
[Learn More](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/irc/emotes)

Get Emote Sets.short: Gets emotes for one or more specified emote sets.
Get Emote Sets.long:
Gets emotes for one or more specified emote sets.
An emote set groups emotes that have a similar context. For example, Twitch places all the subscriber emotes that a broadcaster uploads for their channel in the same emote set.
[Learn More](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/irc/emotes)

params.name: emote_set_id
params.description: An ID that identifies the emote set to get. Include this parameter for each emote set you want to get. For example, `emote_set_id=1234&emote_set_id=5678`. You may specify a maximum of 25 IDs. The response contains only the IDs that were found and ignores duplicate IDs.To get emote set IDs, use the [Get Channel Emotes](#get-channel-emotes) API.

reqBody.name: data
reqBody.description: The list of emotes found in the specified emote sets. The list is empty if none of the IDs were found. The list is in the same order as the set IDs specified in the request. Each set contains one or more emoticons.

reqBody.name: id
reqBody.description: An ID that uniquely identifies this emote.

reqBody.name: name
reqBody.description: The name of the emote. This is the name that viewers type in the chat window to get the emote to appear.

reqBody.name: images
reqBody.description: The image URLs for the emote. These image URLs always provide a static, non-animated emote image with a light background.*NOTE:* You should use the templated URL in the `template` field to fetch the image instead of using these URLs.

reqBody.name: url_1x
reqBody.description: A URL to the small version (28px x 28px) of the emote.

reqBody.name: url_2x
reqBody.description: A URL to the medium version (56px x 56px) of the emote.

reqBody.name: url_4x
reqBody.description: A URL to the large version (112px x 112px) of the emote.

reqBody.name: emote_type
reqBody.description:
The type of emote. The possible values are: - bitstier — A Bits tier emote.
- follower — A follower emote.
- subscriptions — A subscriber emote.

reqBody.name: emote_set_id
reqBody.description: An ID that identifies the emote set that the emote belongs to.

reqBody.name: owner_id
reqBody.description: The ID of the broadcaster who owns the emote.

reqBody.name: format
reqBody.description:
The formats that the emote is available in. For example, if the emote is available only as a static PNG, the array contains only `static`. But if the emote is available as a static PNG and an animated GIF, the array contains `static` and `animated`. The possible formats are: - animated — An animated GIF is available for this emote.
- static — A static PNG file is available for this emote.

reqBody.name: scale
reqBody.description:
The sizes that the emote is available in. For example, if the emote is available in small and medium sizes, the array contains 1.0 and 2.0. Possible sizes are: - 1.0 — A small version (28px x 28px) is available.
- 2.0 — A medium version (56px x 56px) is available.
- 3.0 — A large version (112px x 112px) is available.

reqBody.name: theme_mode
reqBody.description:
The background themes that the emote is available in. Possible themes are: - dark
- light

reqBody.name: template
reqBody.description: A templated URL. Use the values from the `id`, `format`, `scale`, and `theme_mode` fields to replace the like-named placeholder strings in the templated URL to create a CDN (content delivery network) URL that you use to fetch the emote. For information about what the template looks like and how to use it to fetch emotes, see [Emote CDN URL format](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/irc/emotes#cdn-template). You should use this template instead of using the URLs in the `images` object.

codes.200: Successfully retrieved the emotes for the specified emote sets.
codes.400:
- The emote_set_id query parameter is required.
- The number of emote_set_id query parameters exceeds the maximum allowed.
codes.401:
- The Authorization header is required and must specify a valid app access token or user access token.
- The OAuth token is not valid.
- The ID in the Client-Id header must match the Client ID in the OAuth token.

Get Channel Chat Badges.short: Gets the broadcaster’s list of custom chat badges.
Get Channel Chat Badges.long: Gets the broadcaster’s list of custom chat badges. The list is empty if the broadcaster hasn’t created custom chat badges. For information about custom badges, see [subscriber badges](https://help.twitch.tv/s/article/subscriber-badge-guide) and [Bits badges](https://help.twitch.tv/s/article/custom-bit-badges-guide).

Get Global Chat Badges.short: Gets Twitch’s list of chat badges.
Get Global Chat Badges.long: Gets Twitch’s list of chat badges, which users may use in any channel’s chat room. For information about chat badges, see [Twitch Chat Badges Guide](https://help.twitch.tv/s/article/twitch-chat-badges-guide).

Get Chat Settings.long:
Gets the broadcaster’s chat settings.
For an overview of chat settings, see [Chat Commands for Broadcasters and Moderators](https://help.twitch.tv/s/article/chat-commands#AllMods) and [Moderator Preferences](https://help.twitch.tv/s/article/setting-up-moderation-for-your-twitch-channel#modpreferences).

params.name: broadcaster_id
params.description: The ID of the broadcaster whose chat settings you want to get.

params.name: moderator_id
params.description: The ID of the broadcaster or one of the broadcaster’s moderators.This field is required only if you want to include the `non_moderator_chat_delay` and `non_moderator_chat_delay_duration` settings in the response.If you specify this field, this ID must match the user ID in the user access token.

reqBody.name: data
reqBody.description: The list of chat settings. The list contains a single object with all the settings.

reqBody.name: broadcaster_id
reqBody.description: The ID of the broadcaster specified in the request.

reqBody.name: emote_mode
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that determines whether chat messages must contain only emotes. Is *true* if chat messages may contain only emotes; otherwise, *false*.

reqBody.name: follower_mode
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that determines whether the broadcaster restricts the chat room to followers only.Is *true* if the broadcaster restricts the chat room to followers only; otherwise, *false*.See the `follower_mode_duration` field for how long users must follow the broadcaster before being able to participate in the chat room.

reqBody.name: follower_mode_duration
reqBody.description: The length of time, in minutes, that users must follow the broadcaster before being able to participate in the chat room. Is *null* if `follower_mode` is *false*.

reqBody.name: moderator_id
reqBody.description: The moderator’s ID. The response includes this field only if the request specifies a user access token that includes the *moderator:read:chat_settings* scope.

reqBody.name: non_moderator_chat_delay
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that determines whether the broadcaster adds a short delay before chat messages appear in the chat room. This gives chat moderators and bots a chance to remove them before viewers can see the message. See the `non_moderator_chat_delay_duration` field for the length of the delay. Is *true* if the broadcaster applies a delay; otherwise, *false*.The response includes this field only if the request specifies a user access token that includes the *moderator:read:chat_settings* scope and the user in the moderator_id query parameter is one of the broadcaster’s moderators.

reqBody.name: non_moderator_chat_delay_duration
reqBody.description: The amount of time, in seconds, that messages are delayed before appearing in chat. Is *null* if `non_moderator_chat_delay` is *false*.The response includes this field only if the request specifies a user access token that includes the *moderator:read:chat_settings* scope and the user in the moderator_id query parameter is one of the broadcaster’s moderators.

reqBody.name: slow_mode
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that determines whether the broadcaster limits how often users in the chat room are allowed to send messages.Is *true* if the broadcaster applies a delay; otherwise, *false*.See the `slow_mode_wait_time` field for the delay.

reqBody.name: slow_mode_wait_time
reqBody.description: The amount of time, in seconds, that users must wait between sending messages.Is *null* if slow_mode is *false*.

reqBody.name: subscriber_mode
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that determines whether only users that subscribe to the broadcaster’s channel may talk in the chat room.Is *true* if the broadcaster restricts the chat room to subscribers only; otherwise, *false*.

reqBody.name: unique_chat_mode
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that determines whether the broadcaster requires users to post only unique messages in the chat room.Is *true* if the broadcaster requires unique messages only; otherwise, *false*.

codes.200: Successfully retrieved the broadcaster’s chat settings.
codes.400: - The broadcaster_id query parameter is required.
codes.401:
- The Authorization header is required and must specify a valid app access token or user access token.
- The OAuth token is not valid.
- The ID in the Client-Id header must match the Client ID in the OAuth token.

Get Shared Chat Session.short: NEW Retrieves the active shared chat session for a channel.
Get Shared Chat Session.long: NEW Retrieves the active shared chat session for a channel.

params.name: broadcaster_id
params.description: The User ID of the channel broadcaster.

reqBody.name: session_id
reqBody.description: The unique identifier for the shared chat session.

reqBody.name: host_broadcaster_id
reqBody.description: The User ID of the host channel.

reqBody.name: participants
reqBody.description: The list of participants in the session.

reqBody.name: broadcaster_id
reqBody.description: The User ID of the participant channel.

reqBody.name: created_at
reqBody.description: The UTC date and time (in RFC3339 format) for when the session was created.

reqBody.name: updated_at
reqBody.description: The UTC date and time (in RFC3339 format) for when the session was last updated.

codes.200: Successfully retrieved the shared chat session. Returns an empty array if the broadcaster_id in the request isn’t in a shared chat session.
codes.400: The ID in the `broadcaster_id` query parameter is not valid.
codes.401:
- The OAuth token is not valid.
- The Authorization header is required and must contain a user access token.

Get User Emotes.short: Retrieves emotes available to the user across all channels.
Get User Emotes.long: Retrieves emotes available to the user across all channels.

params.name: user_id
params.description: The ID of the user. This ID must match the user ID in the user access token.

params.name: after
params.description: The cursor used to get the next page of results. The Pagination object in the response contains the cursor’s value.

params.name: broadcaster_id
params.description: The User ID of a broadcaster you wish to get follower emotes of. Using this query parameter will guarantee inclusion of the broadcaster’s follower emotes in the response body. *Note:* If the user specified in `user_id` is subscribed to the broadcaster specified, their follower emotes will appear in the response body regardless if this query parameter is used.

reqBody.name: id
reqBody.description: An ID that uniquely identifies this emote.

reqBody.name: name
reqBody.description: The User ID of broadcaster whose channel is receiving the unban request.

reqBody.name: emote_type
reqBody.description:
The type of emote. The possible values are: - none — No emote type was assigned to this emote.
- bitstier — A Bits tier emote.
- follower — A follower emote.
- subscriptions — A subscriber emote.
- channelpoints — An emote granted by using channel points.
- rewards — An emote granted to the user through a special event.
- hypetrain — An emote granted for participation in a Hype Train.
- prime — An emote granted for linking an Amazon Prime account.
- turbo — An emote granted for having Twitch Turbo.
- smilies — Emoticons supported by Twitch.
- globals — An emote accessible by everyone.
- owl2019 — Emotes related to Overwatch League 2019.
- twofactor — Emotes granted by enabling two-factor authentication on an account.
- limitedtime — Emotes that were granted for only a limited time.

reqBody.name: emote_set_id
reqBody.description: An ID that identifies the emote set that the emote belongs to.

reqBody.name: owner_id
reqBody.description: The ID of the broadcaster who owns the emote.

reqBody.name: format
reqBody.description:
The formats that the emote is available in. For example, if the emote is available only as a static PNG, the array contains only static. But if the emote is available as a static PNG and an animated GIF, the array contains static and animated. - animated — An animated GIF is available for this emote.
- static — A static PNG file is available for this emote.

reqBody.name: scale
reqBody.description:
The sizes that the emote is available in. For example, if the emote is available in small and medium sizes, the array contains 1.0 and 2.0. - 1.0 — A small version (28px x 28px) is available.
- 2.0 — A medium version (56px x 56px) is available.
- 3.0 — A large version (112px x 112px) is available.

reqBody.name: theme_mode
reqBody.description:
The background themes that the emote is available in. - dark
- light

reqBody.name: template
reqBody.description: A templated URL. Uses the values from the id, format, scale, and theme_mode fields to replace the like-named placeholder strings in the templated URL to create a CDN (content delivery network) URL that you use to fetch the emote. For information about what the template looks like and how to use it to fetch emotes, see [Emote CDN URL](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/irc/emotes#cdn-template) format.

reqBody.name: pagination
reqBody.description: Contains the information used to page through the list of results. The object is empty if there are no more pages left to page through. For more information about pagination support, see [Twitch API Guide - Pagination](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/api/guide#pagination).

reqBody.name: cursor
reqBody.description: The cursor used to get the next page of results. Use the cursor to set the request’s after query parameter.

codes.200: Successfully retrieved the emotes.
codes.400:
- The user_id query parameter is required.
- The ID in the user_id query parameter is not valid.
codes.401:
- The ID in user_id must match the user ID in the user access token.
- The Authorization header is required and must contain a user access token.
- The user access token must include the user:read:emotes scope.
- The access token is not valid.
- The client ID specified in the Client-Id header does not match the client ID specified in the access token.

Get User Emotes.auth:
- Requires a user access token that includes the *user:read:emotes* scope.

- Query parameter `user_id` must match the `user_id` in the user access token.

params.name: broadcaster_id
params.description: The ID of the broadcaster whose chat settings you want to update.

params.name: moderator_id
params.description: The ID of a user that has permission to moderate the broadcaster’s chat room, or the broadcaster’s ID if they’re making the update. This ID must match the user ID in the user access token.

reqBody.name: emote_mode
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that determines whether chat messages must contain only emotes.Set to *true* if only emotes are allowed; otherwise, *false*. The default is *false*.

reqBody.name: follower_mode
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that determines whether the broadcaster restricts the chat room to followers only.Set to *true* if the broadcaster restricts the chat room to followers only; otherwise, *false*. The default is *true*.To specify how long users must follow the broadcaster before being able to participate in the chat room, see the `follower_mode_duration` field.

reqBody.name: follower_mode_duration
reqBody.description: The length of time, in minutes, that users must follow the broadcaster before being able to participate in the chat room. Set only if `follower_mode` is *true*. Possible values are: 0 (no restriction) through 129600 (3 months). The default is 0.

reqBody.name: non_moderator_chat_delay
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that determines whether the broadcaster adds a short delay before chat messages appear in the chat room. This gives chat moderators and bots a chance to remove them before viewers can see the message.Set to *true* if the broadcaster applies a delay; otherwise, *false*. The default is *false*.To specify the length of the delay, see the `non_moderator_chat_delay_duration` field.

reqBody.name: non_moderator_chat_delay_duration
reqBody.description:
The amount of time, in seconds, that messages are delayed before appearing in chat. Set only if `non_moderator_chat_delay` is *true*. Possible values are:- 2 — 2 second delay (recommended)
- 4 — 4 second delay
- 6 — 6 second delay

reqBody.name: slow_mode
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that determines whether the broadcaster limits how often users in the chat room are allowed to send messages. Set to *true* if the broadcaster applies a wait period between messages; otherwise, *false*. The default is *false*.To specify the delay, see the `slow_mode_wait_time` field.

reqBody.name: slow_mode_wait_time
reqBody.description: The amount of time, in seconds, that users must wait between sending messages. Set only if `slow_mode` is *true*.Possible values are: 3 (3 second delay) through 120 (2 minute delay). The default is 30 seconds.

reqBody.name: subscriber_mode
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that determines whether only users that subscribe to the broadcaster’s channel may talk in the chat room.Set to *true* if the broadcaster restricts the chat room to subscribers only; otherwise, *false*. The default is *false*.

reqBody.name: unique_chat_mode
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that determines whether the broadcaster requires users to post only unique messages in the chat room.Set to *true* if the broadcaster allows only unique messages; otherwise, *false*. The default is *false*.

reqBody.name: data
reqBody.description: The list of chat settings. The list contains a single object with all the settings.

reqBody.name: broadcaster_id
reqBody.description: The ID of the broadcaster specified in the request.

reqBody.name: emote_mode
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that determines whether chat messages must contain only emotes. Is *true* if chat messages may contain only emotes; otherwise, *false*.

reqBody.name: follower_mode
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that determines whether the broadcaster restricts the chat room to followers only.Is *true* if the broadcaster restricts the chat room to followers only; otherwise, *false*.See the `follower_mode_duration` field for how long users must follow the broadcaster before being able to participate in the chat room.

reqBody.name: follower_mode_duration
reqBody.description: The length of time, in minutes, that users must follow the broadcaster before being able to participate in the chat room. Is *null* if `follower_mode` is *false*.

reqBody.name: moderator_id
reqBody.description: The moderator’s ID. The response includes this field only if the request specifies a user access token that includes the *moderator:read:chat_settings* scope.

reqBody.name: non_moderator_chat_delay
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that determines whether the broadcaster adds a short delay before chat messages appear in the chat room. This gives chat moderators and bots a chance to remove them before viewers can see the message. See the `non_moderator_chat_delay_duration` field for the length of the delay. Is *true* if the broadcaster applies a delay; otherwise, *false*.

reqBody.name: non_moderator_chat_delay_duration
reqBody.description: The amount of time, in seconds, that messages are delayed before appearing in chat. Is *null* if `non_moderator_chat_delay` is *false*.

reqBody.name: slow_mode
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that determines whether the broadcaster limits how often users in the chat room are allowed to send messages.Is *true* if the broadcaster applies a delay; otherwise, *false*.See the `slow_mode_wait_time` field for the delay.

reqBody.name: slow_mode_wait_time
reqBody.description: The amount of time, in seconds, that users must wait between sending messages.Is *null* if slow_mode is *false*.

reqBody.name: subscriber_mode
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that determines whether only users that subscribe to the broadcaster’s channel may talk in the chat room.Is *true* if the broadcaster restricts the chat room to subscribers only; otherwise, *false*.

reqBody.name: unique_chat_mode
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that determines whether the broadcaster requires users to post only unique messages in the chat room.Is *true* if the broadcaster requires unique messages only; otherwise, *false*.

codes.200: Successfully updated the broadcaster’s chat settings.
codes.400:
- The broadcaster_id query parameter is required.
- The moderator_id query parameter is required.
- If slow_mode is true, the `slow_mode_wait_time` field must be set to a valid value.
- If `follower_mode` is true, the `follower_mode_duration` field must be set to a valid value.
- If `non_moderator_chat_delay` is true, the `non_moderator_chat_delay_duration` field must be set to a valid value.
codes.401:
- The ID in the moderator_id query parameter must match the user ID in the user access token.
- The Authorization header is required and must contain a user access token.
- The user access token must include the moderator:manage:chat_settings scope.
- The access token is not valid.
- The ID in the Client-Id header must match the client ID in the access token.
codes.403: - The user in the moderator_id query parameter must have moderator privileges in the broadcaster's channel.

Update Chat Settings.auth: Requires a [user access token](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/authentication#user-access-tokens) that includes the *moderator:manage:chat_settings* scope.
Update Chat Settings.reqBodyInfo:
All fields are optional. Specify only those fields that you want to update.
To set the `slow_mode_wait_time` or `follower_mode_duration` field to its default value, set the corresponding `slow_mode` or `follower_mode` field to *true* (and don’t include the `slow_mode_wait_time` or `follower_mode_duration` field).
To set the `slow_mode_wait_time`, `follower_mode_duration`, or `non_moderator_chat_delay_duration` field’s value, you must set the corresponding `slow_mode`, `follower_mode`, or `non_moderator_chat_delay` field to *true*.
To remove the `slow_mode_wait_time`, `follower_mode_duration`, or `non_moderator_chat_delay_duration` field’s value, set the corresponding `slow_mode`, `follower_mode`, or `non_moderator_chat_delay` field to *false* (and don’t include the `slow_mode_wait_time`, `follower_mode_duration`, or `non_moderator_chat_delay_duration` field).

Send Chat Announcement.short: Sends an announcement to the broadcaster’s chat room.
Send Chat Announcement.long:
Sends an announcement to the broadcaster’s chat room.
*Rate Limits*: One announcement may be sent every 2 seconds.

params.name: broadcaster_id
params.description: The ID of the broadcaster that owns the chat room to send the announcement to.

params.name: moderator_id
params.description: The ID of a user who has permission to moderate the broadcaster’s chat room, or the broadcaster’s ID if they’re sending the announcement. This ID must match the user ID in the user access token.

reqBody.name: message
reqBody.description: The announcement to make in the broadcaster’s chat room. Announcements are limited to a maximum of 500 characters; announcements longer than 500 characters are truncated.

reqBody.name: color
reqBody.description:
The color used to highlight the announcement. Possible case-sensitive values are:- blue
- green
- orange
- purple
- primary (default)
If `color` is set to primary or is not set, the channel’s accent color is used to highlight the announcement (see *Profile Accent Color* under [profile settings](https://www.twitch.tv/settings/profile), *Channel and Videos*, and *Brand*).

Send Chat Announcement.auth: Requires a [user access token](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/authentication#user-access-tokens) that includes the *moderator:manage:announcements* scope.

Send a Shoutout.short: Sends a Shoutout to the specified broadcaster.
Send a Shoutout.long:
Sends a Shoutout to the specified broadcaster. Typically, you send Shoutouts when you or one of your moderators notice another broadcaster in your chat, the other broadcaster is coming up in conversation, or after they raid your broadcast.
Twitch’s Shoutout feature is a great way for you to show support for other broadcasters and help them grow. Viewers who do not follow the other broadcaster will see a pop-up Follow button in your chat that they can click to follow the other broadcaster. [Learn More](https://help.twitch.tv/s/article/shoutouts)
*Rate Limits*: The broadcaster may send a Shoutout once every 2 minutes. They may send the same broadcaster a Shoutout once every 60 minutes.
To receive notifications when a Shoutout is sent or received, subscribe to the [channel.shoutout.create](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/eventsub/eventsub-subscription-types#channelshoutoutcreate) and [channel.shoutout.receive](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/eventsub/eventsub-subscription-types#channelshoutoutreceive) subscription types. The *channel.shoutout.create* event includes cooldown periods that indicate when the broadcaster may send another Shoutout without exceeding the endpoint’s rate limit.

params.name: from_broadcaster_id
params.description: The ID of the broadcaster that’s sending the Shoutout.

params.name: to_broadcaster_id
params.description: The ID of the broadcaster that’s receiving the Shoutout.

params.name: moderator_id
params.description: The ID of the broadcaster or a user that is one of the broadcaster’s moderators. This ID must match the user ID in the access token.

Send a Shoutout.auth: Requires a [user access token](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/authentication#user-access-tokens) that includes the *moderator:manage:shoutouts* scope.

Send Chat Message.short: Sends a message to the broadcaster’s chat room.
Send Chat Message.long:
Sends a message to the broadcaster’s chat room.
*NOTE:* When sending messages to a Shared Chat session, behaviors differ depending on your authentication token type:
- When using an App Access Token, messages will only be sent to the source channel (defined by the `broadcaster_id` parameter) by default starting on May 19, 2025. Messages can be sent to all channels by using the `for_source_only` parameter and setting it to `false`.
- When using a User Access Token, messages will be sent to all channels in the shared chat session, including the source channel. This behavior cannot be changed with this token type.

reqBody.name: broadcaster_id
reqBody.description: The ID of the broadcaster whose chat room the message will be sent to.

reqBody.name: sender_id
reqBody.description: The ID of the user sending the message. This ID must match the user ID in the user access token.

reqBody.name: message
reqBody.description: The message to send. The message is limited to a maximum of 500 characters. Chat messages can also include emoticons. To include emoticons, use the name of the emote. The names are case sensitive. Don’t include colons around the name (e.g., :bleedPurple:). If Twitch recognizes the name, Twitch converts the name to the emote before writing the chat message to the chat room

reqBody.name: reply_parent_message_id
reqBody.description: The ID of the chat message being replied to.

reqBody.name: for_source_only
reqBody.description: *NOTE:* This parameter can only be set when utilizing an App Access Token. It cannot be specified when a User Access Token is used, and will instead result in an HTTP 400 error.Determines if the chat message is sent only to the source channel (defined by broadcaster_id) during a shared chat session. This has no effect if the message is not sent during a shared chat session.If this parameter is not set, the default value when using an App Access Token is `false`. On May 19, 2025 the default value for this parameter will be updated to `true`, and chat messages sent using an App Access Token will only be shared with the source channel by default. If you prefer to send a chat message to both channels in a shared chat session, make sure this parameter is explicitly set to `false` in your API request before May 19.

reqBody.name: message_id
reqBody.description: The message id for the message that was sent.

reqBody.name: is_sent
reqBody.description: If the message passed all checks and was sent.

reqBody.name: drop_reason
reqBody.description: The reason the message was dropped, if any.

reqBody.name: code
reqBody.description: Code for why the message was dropped.

reqBody.name: message
reqBody.description: Message for why the message was dropped.

codes.200: Successfully sent the specified broadcaster a message.
codes.400:
- The broadcaster_id query parameter is required.
- The ID in the broadcaster_id query parameter is not valid.
- The sender_id query parameter is required.
- The ID in the sender_id query parameter is not valid.
- The text query parameter is required.
- The ID in the reply_parent_message_id query parameter is not valid.
- Cannot set *for_source_only* if User Access Token is used.
codes.401:
- The ID in the user_id query parameter must match the user ID in the access token.
- The Authorization header is required and must contain a user access token.
- The user access token must include the user:write:chat scope.
- The access token is not valid.
- The client ID specified in the Client-Id header does not match the client ID specified in the access token.
codes.403: The sender is not permitted to send chat messages to the broadcaster’s chat room.

Send Chat Message.auth: Requires an [app access token](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/authentication#app-access-tokens) or [user access token](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/authentication#user-access-tokens) that includes the `user:write:chat` scope. If app access token used, then additionally requires `user:bot` scope from chatting user, and either `channel:bot` scope from broadcaster or moderator status.

Get User Chat Color.short: Gets the color used for the user’s name in chat.
Get User Chat Color.long: Gets the color used for the user’s name in chat.

params.name: user_id

For example, `&user_id=1234&user_id=5678`. The maximum number of IDs that you may specify is 100.The API ignores duplicate IDs and IDs that weren’t found.

codes.200: Successfully retrieved the chat color used by the specified users.

codes.401:

Update User Chat Color.short: Updates the color used for the user’s name in chat.
Update User Chat Color.long: Updates the color used for the user’s name in chat.

The color to use for the user's name in chat. All users may specify one of the following named color values.- blue
- blue_violet
- cadet_blue
- chocolate
- coral
- dodger_blue
- firebrick

Turbo and Prime users may specify a named color or a Hex color code like #9146FF. If you use a Hex color code, remember to URL encode it.

Create Clip.short: Creates a clip from the broadcaster’s stream.
Create Clip.long:
Creates a clip from the broadcaster’s stream.
This API captures up to 90 seconds of the broadcaster’s stream. The 90 seconds spans the point in the stream from when you called the API. For example, if you call the API at the 4:00 minute mark, the API captures from approximately the 2:35 mark to approximately the 4:05 minute mark. Twitch tries its best to capture 90 seconds of the stream, but the actual length may be less. This may occur if you begin capturing the clip near the beginning or end of the stream.
By default, Twitch publishes up to the last 30 seconds of the 90 seconds window and provides a default title for the clip. To specify the title and the portion of the 90 seconds window that’s used for the clip, use the URL in the response’s `edit_url` field. You can specify a clip that’s from 5 seconds to 60 seconds in length. The URL is valid for up to 24 hours or until the clip is published, whichever comes first.
Creating a clip is an asynchronous process that can take a short amount of time to complete. To determine whether the clip was successfully created, call [Get Clips](#get-clips) using the clip ID that this request returned. If Get Clips returns the clip, the clip was successfully created. If after 15 seconds Get Clips hasn’t returned the clip, assume it failed.

params.name: broadcaster_id
params.description: The ID of the broadcaster whose stream you want to create a clip from.

params.name: title
params.description: The title of the clip.

params.name: duration
params.description: The length of the clip in seconds. Possible values range from 5 to 60 inclusively with a precision of 0.1. The default is 30.

reqBody.name: data
reqBody.description: A list containing the created clip.

reqBody.name: id
reqBody.description: An ID that uniquely identifies the clip.

reqBody.name: edit_url
reqBody.description: A URL that you can use to edit the clip’s title, identify the part of the clip to publish, and publish the clip. [Learn More](https://help.twitch.tv/s/article/how-to-use-clips)The URL is valid for up to 24 hours or until the clip is published, whichever comes first.

codes.400:
- The broadcaster_id query parameter is required.
- The ID in the broadcaster_id query parameter was not found.
- The category is not clippable.
- The title did not pass AutoMod checks.
codes.401:
- The Authorization header is required and must specify user access token.
- The user access token must include the clips:edit scope.
- The OAuth token is not valid.
- The ID in the Client-Id header must match the Client ID in the OAuth token.
codes.403:
- The broadcaster has restricted the ability to capture clips to followers and/or subscribers only.
- The specified broadcaster has not enabled clips on their channel.
- The user is banned or timed out from the broadcaster’s channel.
codes.404: - The broadcaster in the broadcaster_id query parameter must be broadcasting live.

Create Clip.auth: Requires a [user access token](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/authentication#user-access-tokens) that includes the *clips:edit* scope.

Create Clip From VOD.short: NEW Creates a clip from the broadcaster’s VOD.
Create Clip From VOD.long:
NEW Creates a clip from a broadcaster’s VOD on behalf of the broadcaster or an editor of the channel. Since a live stream is actively creating a VOD, this endpoint can also be used to create a clip from earlier in the current stream.
The duration of a clip can be from 5 seconds to 60 seconds in length, with a default of 30 seconds if not specified.
`vod_offset` indicates where the clip will end. In other words, the clip will start at (`vod_offset` - `duration`) and end at `vod_offset`. This means that the value of `vod_offset` must greater than or equal to the value of `duration`.
The URL in the response’s `edit_url` field allows you to edit the clip’s title, feature the clip, create a portrait version of the clip, download the clip media, and share the clip directly to social platforms.

params.name: editor_id
params.description: The user ID of the editor for the channel you want to create a clip for. If using the broadcaster’s auth token, this is the same as broadcaster_id. This must match the user_id in the user access token.

params.name: broadcaster_id
params.description: The user ID for the channel you want to create a clip for.

params.name: vod_id
params.description: ID of the VOD the user wants to clip.

params.name: vod_offset
params.description: Offset in the VOD to create the clip. See notes above.

params.name: duration
params.description: The length of the clip, in seconds. Precision is 0.1. Defaults to 30. Min: 5 seconds, Max: 60 seconds.

params.name: title
params.description: The title of the clip.

reqBody.name: data
reqBody.description: A list containing the created clip.

reqBody.name: id
reqBody.description: An ID that uniquely identifies the clip.

reqBody.name: edit_url
reqBody.description: A URL you can use to edit the clip’s title, feature the clip, create a portrait version of the clip, download the clip media, and share the clip directly to third-party platforms.

codes.400:
- Validation errors: Invalid source type, missing required fields.
- The broadcaster_id query parameter is required.
- The ID in the broadcaster_id query parameter was not found.
- The category is not clippable.
- The title did not pass AutoMod checks.
- Broadcaster is banned.
codes.401:
- The Authorization header is required and must specify user access token.
- The user access token must include the editor:manage:clips or channel:manage:clips scope.
- The OAuth token is not valid.
- The ID in the Client-Id header must match the Client ID in the OAuth token.
codes.403:
- The broadcaster has restricted the ability to capture clips to followers and/or subscribers only.
- The specified broadcaster has not enabled clips on their channel.
- The user defined by the editor_id is not authorized to create Clips.
- The user is banned or timed out from the broadcaster's channel.
codes.404:
- The broadcaster in the broadcaster_id query parameter must be broadcasting live.
- The VOD is not found..
- The broadcaster_id or the editor_id does not exist.

Create Clip From VOD.auth: Requires an [app access token](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/authentication#app-access-tokens) or [user access token](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/authentication#user-access-tokens) that includes the *editor:manage:clips* or *channel:manage:clips* scope.

Get Clips.short: Gets one or more video clips.
Get Clips.long:
Gets one or more video clips that were captured from streams. For information about clips, see [How to use clips](https://help.twitch.tv/s/article/how-to-use-clips).
When using pagination for clips, note that the maximum number of results returned over multiple requests will be approximately 1,000. If additional results are necessary, paginate over different query parameters such as multiple `started_at` and `ended_at` timeframes to refine the search.

params.name: broadcaster_id
params.description: An ID that identifies the broadcaster whose video clips you want to get. Use this parameter to get clips that were captured from the broadcaster’s streams.

params.name: game_id
params.description: An ID that identifies the game whose clips you want to get. Use this parameter to get clips that were captured from streams that were playing this game.

params.name: id
params.description: An ID that identifies the clip to get. To specify more than one ID, include this parameter for each clip you want to get. For example, `id=foo&id=bar`. You may specify a maximum of 100 IDs. The API ignores duplicate IDs and IDs that aren’t found.

params.name: started_at
params.description: The start date used to filter clips. The API returns only clips within the start and end date window. Specify the date and time in RFC3339 format.

params.name: ended_at
params.description: The end date used to filter clips. If not specified, the time window is the start date plus one week. Specify the date and time in RFC3339 format.

params.name: first
params.description: The maximum number of clips to return per page in the response. The minimum page size is 1 clip per page and the maximum is 100. The default is 20.

params.name: before
params.description: The cursor used to get the previous page of results. The *Pagination* object in the response contains the cursor’s value. [Read More](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/api/guide#pagination)

params.name: after
params.description: The cursor used to get the next page of results. The *Pagination* object in the response contains the cursor’s value. [Read More](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/api/guide#pagination)

params.name: is_featured
params.description: A Boolean value that determines whether the response includes featured clips. If *true*, returns only clips that are featured. If *false*, returns only clips that aren’t featured. All clips are returned if this parameter is not present.

reqBody.name: data
reqBody.description: The list of video clips. For clips returned by game_id or broadcaster_id, the list is in descending order by view count. For lists returned by id, the list is in the same order as the input IDs.

reqBody.name: id
reqBody.description: An ID that uniquely identifies the clip.

reqBody.name: url
reqBody.description: A URL to the clip.

reqBody.name: embed_url
reqBody.description: A URL that you can use in an iframe to embed the clip (see [Embedding Video and Clips](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/embed/video-and-clips/)).

reqBody.name: broadcaster_id
reqBody.description: An ID that identifies the broadcaster that the video was clipped from.

reqBody.name: broadcaster_name
reqBody.description: The broadcaster’s display name.

reqBody.name: creator_id
reqBody.description: An ID that identifies the user that created the clip.

reqBody.name: creator_name
reqBody.description: The user’s display name.

reqBody.name: video_id
reqBody.description: An ID that identifies the video that the clip came from. This field contains an empty string if the video is not available.

reqBody.name: game_id
reqBody.description: The ID of the game that was being played when the clip was created.

reqBody.name: language
reqBody.description: The ISO 639-1 two-letter language code that the broadcaster broadcasts in. For example, en for English. The value is other if the broadcaster uses a language that Twitch doesn’t support.

reqBody.name: title
reqBody.description: The title of the clip.

reqBody.name: view_count
reqBody.description: The number of times the clip has been viewed.

reqBody.name: created_at
reqBody.description: The date and time of when the clip was created. The date and time is in RFC3339 format.

reqBody.name: thumbnail_url
reqBody.description: A URL to a thumbnail image of the clip.

reqBody.name: duration
reqBody.description: The length of the clip, in seconds. Precision is 0.1.

reqBody.name: vod_offset
reqBody.description: The zero-based offset, in seconds, to where the clip starts in the video (VOD). Is *null* if the video is not available or hasn’t been created yet from the live stream (see `video_id`).Note that there’s a delay between when a clip is created during a broadcast and when the offset is set. During the delay period, `vod_offset` is *null*. The delay is indeterminant but is typically minutes long.

reqBody.name: is_featured
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that indicates if the clip is featured or not.

reqBody.name: pagination
reqBody.description: The information used to page through the list of results. The object is empty if there are no more pages left to page through. [Read More](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/api/guide#pagination)

reqBody.name: cursor
reqBody.description: The cursor used to get the next page of results. Set the request’s after or before query parameter to this value depending on whether you’re paging forwards or backwards.

codes.200: Successfully retrieved the list of video clips.
codes.400:
- The id or game_id or broadcaster_id query parameter is required.
- The id, game_id, and broadcaster_id query parameters are mutually exclusive; you may specify only one of them.
codes.401:
- The Authorization header is required and must contain an app access token or user access token.
- The OAuth token is not valid.
- The client ID specified in the Client-Id header does not match the client ID specified in the OAuth token.
codes.404: - The ID in game_id was not found.

Get Clips.paramsInfo: The id, game_id, and broadcaster_id query parameters are mutually exclusive.

Get Clips Download.short: NEW Provides URLs to download the video file(s) for the specified clips.
Get Clips Download.long:
NEW Provides URLs to download the video file(s) for the specified clips. For information about clips, see [How to use clips](https://help.twitch.tv/s/article/how-to-use-clips).
*Rate Limits*: Limited to 100 requests per minute.

params.name: editor_id
params.description: The User ID of the editor for the channel you want to download a clip for. If using the broadcaster’s auth token, this is the same as `broadcaster_id`. This must match the `user_id` in the user access token.

params.name: broadcaster_id
params.description: The ID of the broadcaster you want to download clips for.

params.name: clip_id
params.description: The ID that identifies the clip you want to download. Include this parameter for each clip you want to download, up to a maximum of 10 clips. For example, `clip_id=SleepyGiftedPeppermintNerfRedBlaster-KbkBXYt3lOk3jy8-&clip_id=WimpyAltruisticKleeKeyboardCat-EiY5yMrEwZ4i4gwC`.

reqBody.name: data
reqBody.description: List of clips and their download URLs.

reqBody.name: clip_id
reqBody.description: An ID that uniquely identifies the clip.

reqBody.name: landscape_download_url
reqBody.description: The landscape URL to download the clip. This field is `null` if the URL is not available.

reqBody.name: portrait_download_url
reqBody.description: The portrait URL to download the clip. This field is `null` if the URL is not available.

codes.200: Successfully retrieved the clip download URL(s).
codes.400: The ID in the broadcaster_id, editor_id, or clip_id query parameter is not valid.
codes.401:
- The OAuth token is not valid.
- The Authorization header is required and must contain a user access token or app access token.
- The access token must include the editor:manage:clips or channel:manage:clips scope
- The access token is not valid
- The client ID specified in the Client-Id header does not match the client ID specified in the access token.
codes.403: The user is not an editor for the specified broadcaster.

Get Clips Download.auth: Requires an [app access token](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/authentication#app-access-tokens) or [user access token](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/authentication#user-access-tokens) that includes the `editor:manage:clips` or `channel:manage:clips` scope.

Get Conduits.short: Gets the conduits for a client ID.
Get Conduits.long: Gets the [conduits](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/eventsub/handling-conduit-events/) for a client ID.

reqBody.name: data
reqBody.description: List of information about the client’s conduits.

reqBody.name: id
reqBody.description: Conduit ID.

reqBody.name: shard_count
reqBody.description: Number of shards associated with this conduit.

codes.200: Successfully retrieved conduits.
codes.401: Authorization header required with an app access token.

reqBody.name: shard_count
reqBody.description: The number of shards to create for this conduit.

reqBody.name: data
reqBody.description: List of information about the client’s conduits.

reqBody.name: id
reqBody.description: Conduit ID.

reqBody.name: shard_count
reqBody.description: Number of shards created for this conduit.

codes.200: Conduit created.
codes.400: Invalid shard count.
codes.401: Authorization header required with an app access token.

Update Conduits.long: Updates a [conduit’s](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/eventsub/handling-conduit-events/) shard count. To delete shards, update the count to a lower number, and the shards above the count will be deleted. For example, if the existing shard count is 100, by resetting shard count to 50, shards 50-99 are disabled.

reqBody.name: id
reqBody.description: Conduit ID.

reqBody.name: shard_count
reqBody.description: The new number of shards for this conduit.

reqBody.name: data
reqBody.description: List of information about the client’s conduits.

reqBody.name: id
reqBody.description: Conduit ID.

reqBody.name: shard_count
reqBody.description: Number of shards associated with this conduit after the update.

codes.200: Conduit updated.
codes.400:
- Invalid shard count
- The id query parameter is required.
codes.401: Authorization header required with an app access token.
codes.404:
- Conduit not found.
- Conduit’s owner must match the client ID in the access token.

Delete Conduit.long: Deletes a specified [conduit](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/eventsub/handling-conduit-events/). Note that it may take some time for Eventsub subscriptions on a deleted [conduit](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/eventsub/handling-conduit-events/) to show as disabled when calling [Get Eventsub Subscriptions](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/api/reference/#get-eventsub-subscriptions).

params.name: id
params.description: Conduit ID.

codes.400: The id query parameter is required.
codes.401: Authorization header required with an app access token.
codes.404:
- Conduit not found.
- Conduit’s owner must match the client ID in the access token.

Get Conduit Shards.short: Gets a lists of all shards for a conduit.
Get Conduit Shards.long: Gets a lists of all shards for a [conduit](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/eventsub/handling-conduit-events/).

params.name: conduit_id
params.description: Conduit ID.

params.name: status
params.description: Status to filter by.

params.name: after
params.description: The cursor used to get the next page of results. The pagination object in the response contains the cursor’s value.

reqBody.name: data
reqBody.description: List of information about a conduit's shards.

reqBody.name: id
reqBody.description: Shard ID.

reqBody.name: status
reqBody.description:
The shard status. The subscriber receives events only for enabled shards. Possible values are:- enabled — The shard is enabled.
- webhook_callback_verification_pending — The shard is pending verification of the specified callback URL.
- webhook_callback_verification_failed — The specified callback URL failed verification.
- notification_failures_exceeded — The notification delivery failure rate was too high.
- websocket_disconnected — The client closed the connection.
- websocket_failed_ping_pong — The client failed to respond to a ping message.
- websocket_received_inbound_traffic — The client sent a non-pong message. Clients may only send pong messages (and only in response to a ping message).
- websocket_internal_error — The Twitch WebSocket server experienced an unexpected error.
- websocket_network_timeout — The Twitch WebSocket server timed out writing the message to the client.
- websocket_network_error — The Twitch WebSocket server experienced a network error writing the message to the client.
- websocket_failed_to_reconnect - The client failed to reconnect to the Twitch WebSocket server within the required time after a Reconnect Message.

reqBody.name: transport
reqBody.description: The transport details used to send the notifications.

reqBody.name: method
reqBody.description:
The transport method. Possible values are:- webhook
- websocket

reqBody.name: callback
reqBody.description: The callback URL where the notifications are sent. Included only if method is set to webhook.

reqBody.name: session_id
reqBody.description: An ID that identifies the WebSocket that notifications are sent to. Included only if method is set to websocket.

reqBody.name: connected_at
reqBody.description: The UTC date and time that the WebSocket connection was established. Included only if method is set to websocket.

reqBody.name: disconnected_at
reqBody.description: The UTC date and time that the WebSocket connection was lost. Included only if method is set to websocket.

reqBody.name: pagination
reqBody.description: Contains information used to page through a list of results. The object is empty if there are no more pages left to page through.

reqBody.name: cursor
reqBody.description: The cursor used to get the next page of results. Use the cursor to set the request’s after query parameter.

codes.200: Successfully retrieved shards.
codes.400: The id query parameter is required.
codes.401: Authorization header required with an app access token.
codes.404:
- Conduit not found.
- Conduit’s owner must match the client ID in the access token.

Update Conduit Shards.long:
Updates shard(s) for a [conduit](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/eventsub/handling-conduit-events/).
*NOTE:* Shard IDs are indexed starting at 0, so a conduit with a `shard_count` of 5 will have shards with IDs 0 through 4.

reqBody.name: conduit_id
reqBody.description: Conduit ID.

reqBody.name: shards
reqBody.description: List of shards to update.

reqBody.name: id
reqBody.description: Shard ID.

reqBody.name: transport
reqBody.description: The transport details that you want Twitch to use when sending you notifications.

reqBody.name: method
reqBody.description:
The transport method. Possible values are:- webhook
- websocket

reqBody.name: callback
reqBody.description: The callback URL where the notifications are sent. The URL must use the HTTPS protocol and port 443. See Processing an event.Specify this field only if method is set to webhook.NOTE: Redirects are not followed.

reqBody.name: secret
reqBody.description: The secret used to verify the signature. The secret must be an ASCII string that’s a minimum of 10 characters long and a maximum of 100 characters long. For information about how the secret is used, see Verifying the event message.Specify this field only if method is set to webhook.

reqBody.name: session_id
reqBody.description: An ID that identifies the WebSocket to send notifications to. When you connect to EventSub using WebSockets, the server returns the ID in the Welcome message.Specify this field only if method is set to websocket.

reqBody.name: data
reqBody.description: List of successful shard updates.

reqBody.name: id
reqBody.description: Shard ID.

reqBody.name: status
reqBody.description:
The shard status. The subscriber receives events only for enabled shards. Possible values are:- enabled — The shard is enabled.
- webhook_callback_verification_pending — The shard is pending verification of the specified callback URL.
- webhook_callback_verification_failed — The specified callback URL failed verification.
- notification_failures_exceeded — The notification delivery failure rate was too high.
- websocket_disconnected — The client closed the connection.
- websocket_failed_ping_pong — The client failed to respond to a ping message.
- websocket_received_inbound_traffic — The client sent a non-pong message. Clients may only send pong messages (and only in response to a ping message).
- websocket_internal_error — The Twitch WebSocket server experienced an unexpected error.
- websocket_network_timeout — The Twitch WebSocket server timed out writing the message to the client.
- websocket_network_error — The Twitch WebSocket server experienced a network error writing the message to the client.
- websocket_failed_to_reconnect - The client failed to reconnect to the Twitch WebSocket server within the required time after a Reconnect Message.

reqBody.name: transport
reqBody.description: The transport details used to send the notifications.

reqBody.name: method
reqBody.description:
The transport method. Possible values are:- webhook
- websocket

reqBody.name: callback
reqBody.description: The callback URL where the notifications are sent. Included only if method is set to webhook.

reqBody.name: session_id
reqBody.description: An ID that identifies the WebSocket that notifications are sent to. Included only if method is set to websocket.

reqBody.name: connected_at
reqBody.description: The UTC date and time that the WebSocket connection was established. Included only if method is set to websocket.

reqBody.name: disconnected_at
reqBody.description: The UTC date and time that the WebSocket connection was lost. Included only if method is set to websocket.

reqBody.name: errors
reqBody.description: List of unsuccessful updates.

reqBody.name: id
reqBody.description: Shard ID.

reqBody.name: message
reqBody.description:
The error that occurred while updating the shard. Possible errors:- The length of the string in the secret field is not valid.
- The URL in the transport's callback field is not valid. The URL must use the HTTPS protocol and the 443 port number.
- The value specified in the method field is not valid.
- The callback field is required if you specify the webhook transport method.
- The session_id field is required if you specify the WebSocket transport method.
- The websocket session is not connected.
- The shard id is outside of the conduit’s range.

reqBody.name: code
reqBody.description: Error codes used to represent a specific error condition while attempting to update shards.

codes.400: The id query parameter is required.
codes.401: Authorization header required with an app access token.
codes.404:
- Conduit not found.
- Conduit’s owner must match the client ID in the access token.

Get Content Classification Labels.short: Gets information about Twitch content classification labels.
Get Content Classification Labels.long: Gets information about Twitch content classification labels.

params.name: locale
params.description: Locale for the Content Classification Labels. You may specify a maximum of 1 locale. Default: `“en-US”`Supported locales: `"bg-BG", "cs-CZ", "da-DK", "da-DK", "de-DE", "el-GR", "en-GB", "en-US", "es-ES", "es-MX", "fi-FI", "fr-FR", "hu-HU", "it-IT", "ja-JP", "ko-KR", "nl-NL", "no-NO", "pl-PL", "pt-BT", "pt-PT", "ro-RO", "ru-RU", "sk-SK", "sv-SE", "th-TH", "tr-TR", "vi-VN", "zh-CN", "zh-TW"`

reqBody.name: data
reqBody.description: A list that contains information about the available content classification labels.

reqBody.name: content_classification_labels
reqBody.description: The list of CCLs available.

reqBody.name: id
reqBody.description: Unique identifier for the CCL.

reqBody.name: description
reqBody.description: Localized description of the CCL.

reqBody.name: name
reqBody.description: Localized name of the CCL.

Get Drops Entitlements.short: Gets an organization’s list of entitlements that have been granted to a game, a user, or both.
Get Drops Entitlements.long:
Gets an organization’s list of entitlements that have been granted to a game, a user, or both.
*NOTE:* Entitlements returned in the response body data are not guaranteed to be sorted by any field returned by the API. To retrieve *CLAIMED* or *FULFILLED* entitlements, use the `fulfillment_status` query parameter to filter results. To retrieve entitlements for a specific game, use the `game_id` query parameter to filter results.
The following table identifies the request parameters that you may specify based on the type of access token used.
Access token type Parameter Description App None If you don’t specify request parameters, the request returns all entitlements that your organization owns. App user_id The request returns all entitlements for any game that the organization granted to the specified user. App user_id, game_id The request returns all entitlements that the specified game granted to the specified user. App game_id The request returns all entitlements that the specified game granted to all entitled users. User None If you don’t specify request parameters, the request returns all entitlements for any game that the organization granted to the user identified in the access token. User user_id Invalid. User user_id, game_id Invalid. User game_id The request returns all entitlements that the specified game granted to the user identified in the access token.

params.name: id
params.description: An ID that identifies the entitlement to get. Include this parameter for each entitlement you want to get. For example, `id=1234&id=5678`. You may specify a maximum of 100 IDs.

params.name: user_id
params.description: An ID that identifies a user that was granted entitlements.

params.name: game_id
params.description: An ID that identifies a game that offered entitlements.

params.name: fulfillment_status
params.description:
The entitlement’s fulfillment status. Used to filter the list to only those with the specified status. Possible values are: - CLAIMED
- FULFILLED

params.name: after
params.description: The cursor used to get the next page of results. The *Pagination* object in the response contains the cursor’s value. [Read More](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/api/guide#pagination)

params.name: first
params.description: The maximum number of entitlements to return per page in the response. The minimum page size is 1 entitlement per page and the maximum is 1000. The default is 20.

reqBody.name: data
reqBody.description: The list of entitlements.

reqBody.name: id
reqBody.description: An ID that identifies the entitlement.

reqBody.name: benefit_id
reqBody.description: An ID that identifies the benefit (reward).

reqBody.name: timestamp
reqBody.description: The UTC date and time (in RFC3339 format) of when the entitlement was granted.

reqBody.name: user_id
reqBody.description: An ID that identifies the user who was granted the entitlement.

reqBody.name: game_id
reqBody.description: An ID that identifies the game the user was playing when the reward was entitled.

reqBody.name: fulfillment_status
reqBody.description:
The entitlement’s fulfillment status. Possible values are: - CLAIMED
- FULFILLED

reqBody.name: last_updated
reqBody.description: The UTC date and time (in RFC3339 format) of when the entitlement was last updated.

reqBody.name: pagination
reqBody.description: The information used to page through the list of results. The object is empty if there are no more pages left to page through. [Read More](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/api/guide#pagination)

reqBody.name: cursor
reqBody.description: The cursor used to get the next page of results. Set the request’s after query parameter to this value to page forward through the results.

codes.200: Successfully retrieved the entitlements.
codes.400:
- The value in the fulfillment_status query parameter is not valid.
- The ID in the user_id query parameter must match the user ID in the user access token.
- The client in the access token is not associated with a known organization.
- The owner of the client in the access token is not a member of the organization.
codes.401:
- The ID in the Client-Id header must match the Client ID in the access token.
- The Authorization header is required and must specify an app access token or user access token.
- The access token is not valid.
codes.403:
- The organization associated with the client in the access token must own the game specified in the game_id query parameter.
- The organization associated with the client in the access token must own the entitlements specified in the id query parameter.

Get Drops Entitlements.auth: Requires an [app access token](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/authentication#app-access-tokens) or [user access token](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/authentication#user-access-tokens). The Client ID associated with the access token must be owned by a user who is a member of the [organization](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/docs/companies/) that holds ownership of the game.

Update Drops Entitlements.short: Updates the Drop entitlement’s fulfillment status.
Update Drops Entitlements.long:
Updates the Drop entitlement’s fulfillment status.
The following table identifies which entitlements are updated based on the type of access token used.
Access token type Data that’s updated App Updates all entitlements with benefits owned by the organization in the access token. User Updates all entitlements owned by the user in the access token and where the benefits are owned by the organization in the access token.

reqBody.name: entitlement_ids
reqBody.description: A list of IDs that identify the entitlements to update. You may specify a maximum of 100 IDs.

reqBody.name: fulfillment_status
reqBody.description:
The fulfillment status to set the entitlements to. Possible values are:- CLAIMED — The user claimed the benefit.
- FULFILLED — The developer granted the benefit that the user claimed.

reqBody.name: data
reqBody.description: A list that indicates which entitlements were successfully updated and those that weren’t.

reqBody.name: status
reqBody.description:
A string that indicates whether the status of the entitlements in the `ids` field were successfully updated. Possible values are:- INVALID_ID — The entitlement IDs in the `ids` field are not valid.
- NOT_FOUND — The entitlement IDs in the `ids` field were not found.
- SUCCESS — The status of the entitlements in the `ids` field were successfully updated.
- UNAUTHORIZED — The user or organization identified by the user access token is not authorized to update the entitlements.
- UPDATE_FAILED — The update failed. These are considered transient errors and the request should be retried later.

reqBody.name: ids
reqBody.description: The list of entitlements that the status in the `status` field applies to.

codes.200: Successfully requested the updates. Check the response to determine which updates succeeded.
codes.400:
- The value in the `fulfillment_status` field is not valid.
- The client in the access token is not associated with a known organization.
- The owner of the client in the access token is not a member of the organization.
codes.401:
- The Authorization header is required and must specify an app access token or user access token.
- The access token is not valid.
- The ID in the Client-Id header must match the Client ID in the access token.

Update Drops Entitlements.auth: Requires an [app access token](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/authentication#app-access-tokens) or [user access token](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/authentication#user-access-tokens). The Client ID associated with the access token must be owned by a user who is a member of the [organization](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/docs/companies/) that holds ownership of the game.

Get Extension Configuration Segment.short: Gets the specified configuration segment from the specified extension.
Get Extension Configuration Segment.long:
Gets the specified configuration segment from the specified extension.
*Rate Limits*: You may retrieve each segment a maximum of 20 times per minute.

params.name: broadcaster_id
params.description: The ID of the broadcaster that installed the extension. This parameter is required if you set the segment parameter to broadcaster or developer. Do not specify this parameter if you set segment to global.

params.name: extension_id
params.description: The ID of the extension that contains the configuration segment you want to get.

params.name: segment
params.description:
The type of configuration segment to get. Possible case-sensitive values are: - broadcaster
- developer
- global
You may specify one or more segments. To specify multiple segments, include the `segment` parameter for each segment to get. For example, `segment=broadcaster&segment=developer`. Ignores duplicate segments.

reqBody.name: data
reqBody.description: The list of requested configuration segments. The list is returned in the same order that you specified the list of segments in the request.

reqBody.name: segment
reqBody.description:
The type of segment. Possible values are: - broadcaster
- developer
- global

reqBody.name: broadcaster_id
reqBody.description: The ID of the broadcaster that installed the extension. The object includes this field only if the `segment` query parameter is set to developer or broadcaster.

reqBody.name: content
reqBody.description: The contents of the segment. This string may be a plain-text string or a string-encoded JSON object.

reqBody.name: version
reqBody.description: The version number that identifies this definition of the segment’s data.

codes.200: Successfully retrieved the configurations.
codes.400:
- The extension_id query parameter is required.
- The value in the segment query parameter is not valid.
- The broadcaster_id query parameter is required if the segment query parameter is set to broadcaster or developer.
codes.401:
- The Authorization header is required and must specify a JWT token.
- The JWT token is not valid.
- The Client-Id header is required.
codes.429: - The app exceeded the number of requests that it may make per minute. See Rate Limits above.

Get Extension Configuration Segment.auth: Requires a signed JSON Web Token (JWT) created by an Extension Backend Service (EBS). For signing requirements, see [Signing the JWT](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/extensions/building/#signing-the-jwt). The signed JWT must include the `role`, `user_id`, and `exp` fields (see [JWT Schema](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/extensions/reference/#jwt-schema)). The `role` field must be set to external.

Set Extension Configuration Segment.long:
Updates a configuration segment. The segment is limited to 5 KB. Extensions that are active on a channel do not receive the updated configuration.
*Rate Limits*: You may update the configuration a maximum of 20 times per minute.

reqBody.name: extension_id
reqBody.description: The ID of the extension to update.

reqBody.name: segment
reqBody.description:
The configuration segment to update. Possible case-sensitive values are:- broadcaster
- developer
- global

reqBody.name: broadcaster_id
reqBody.description: The ID of the broadcaster that installed the extension. Include this field only if the `segment` is set to developer or broadcaster.

reqBody.name: content
reqBody.description: The contents of the segment. This string may be a plain-text string or a string-encoded JSON object.

reqBody.name: version
reqBody.description: The version number that identifies this definition of the segment’s data. If not specified, the latest definition is updated.

codes.400: - The `broadcaster_id` field is required if `segment` is set to developer or broadcaster.
codes.401:
- The Authorization header is required and must specify a JWT token.
- The JWT token is not valid.
- The Client-Id header is required.

Set Extension Configuration Segment.auth: Requires a signed JSON Web Token (JWT) created by an Extension Backend Service (EBS). For signing requirements, see [Signing the JWT](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/extensions/building/#signing-the-jwt). The signed JWT must include the `role`, `user_id`, and `exp` fields (see [JWT Schema](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/extensions/reference/#jwt-schema)). The `role` field must be set to external.

Set Extension Required Configuration.long: Updates the extension’s required_configuration string. Use this endpoint if your extension requires the broadcaster to configure the extension before activating it (to require configuration, you must select *Custom/My Own Service* in Extension [Capabilities](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/extensions/life-cycle/#capabilities)). For more information, see [Required Configurations](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/extensions/building#required-configurations) and [Setting Required Configuration](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/extensions/building#setting-required-configuration-with-the-configuration-service-optional).

params.name: broadcaster_id
params.description: The ID of the broadcaster that installed the extension on their channel.

reqBody.name: extension_id
reqBody.description: The ID of the extension to update.

reqBody.name: extension_version
reqBody.description: The version of the extension to update.

reqBody.name: required_configuration
reqBody.description: The required_configuration string to use with the extension.

codes.204: Successfully updated the extension’s required_configuration string.
codes.400:
- The broadcaster_id query parameter is required.
- The `extension_id` field is required.
- The `extension_version` field is required.
- The `required_configuration` field is required.
codes.401:
- The Authorization header is required and must specify a JWT token.
- The JWT token is not valid.
- The Client-Id header is required.

Set Extension Required Configuration.auth: Requires a signed JSON Web Token (JWT) created by an EBS. For signing requirements, see [Signing the JWT](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/extensions/building/#signing-the-jwt).
