The signed JWT must include the `role`, `user_id`, and `exp` fields (see [JWT Schema](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/extensions/reference/#jwt-schema)). Set the `role` field to external and the `user_id` field to the ID of the user that owns the extension.

Send Extension PubSub Message.short: Sends a message to one or more viewers.
Send Extension PubSub Message.long:
Sends a message to one or more viewers. You can send messages to a specific channel or to all channels where your extension is active. This endpoint uses the same mechanism as the [send](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/extensions/reference#send) JavaScript helper function used to send messages.
*Rate Limits*: You may send a maximum of 100 messages per minute per combination of extension client ID and broadcaster ID.
Send Extension PubSub Message.auth: Requires a signed JSON Web Token (JWT) created by an Extension Backend Service (EBS). For signing requirements, see [Signing the JWT](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/extensions/building/#signing-the-jwt). The signed JWT must include the `role`, `user_id`, and `exp` fields (see [JWT Schema](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/extensions/reference/#jwt-schema)) along with the `channel_id` and `pubsub_perms` fields. The `role` field must be set to external.

Get Extension Live Channels.short: Gets a list of broadcasters that are streaming live and have installed or activated the extension.
Get Extension Live Channels.long:
Gets a list of broadcasters that are streaming live and have installed or activated the extension.
It may take a few minutes for the list to include or remove broadcasters that have recently gone live or stopped broadcasting.

params.name: extension_id
params.description: The ID of the extension to get. Returns the list of broadcasters that are live and that have installed or activated this extension.

params.name: first
params.description: The specific maximum number of items per page in the response. The actual number returned may be less than this limit. [Read More](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/api/guide#pagination)

params.name: after
params.description: The cursor used to get the next page of results. The `pagination` field in the response contains the cursor’s value. [Read More](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/api/guide#pagination)

reqBody.name: data
reqBody.description: The list of broadcasters that are streaming live and that have installed or activated the extension.

reqBody.name: broadcaster_id
reqBody.description: The ID of the broadcaster that is streaming live and has installed or activated the extension.

reqBody.name: broadcaster_name
reqBody.description: The broadcaster’s display name.

reqBody.name: game_name
reqBody.description: The name of the category or game being streamed.

reqBody.name: game_id
reqBody.description: The ID of the category or game being streamed.

reqBody.name: title
reqBody.description: The title of the broadcaster’s stream. May be an empty string if not specified.

reqBody.name: pagination
reqBody.description: This field contains the cursor used to page through the results. The field is empty if there are no more pages left to page through. Note that this field is a string compared to other endpoints that use a *Pagination* object. [Read More](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/api/guide#pagination)

codes.200: Successfully retrieved the list of broadcasters.
codes.400:
- The extension_id query parameter is required.
- The pagination cursor is not valid.
codes.401:
- The Authorization header is required and must specify an app access token or user access token.
- The access token is not valid.
- The ID in the Client-Id header must match the client ID in the access token.
codes.404: - The extension specified in the extension_id query parameter was not found or it's not being used in a live stream.

Get Extension Secrets.short: Gets an extension’s list of shared secrets.
Get Extension Secrets.long: Gets an extension’s list of shared secrets.
Get Extension Secrets.auth: Requires a signed JSON Web Token (JWT) created by an Extension Backend Service (EBS). For signing requirements, see [Signing the JWT](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/extensions/building/#signing-the-jwt). The signed JWT must include the `role`, `user_id`, and `exp` fields (see [JWT Schema](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/extensions/reference/#jwt-schema)). The `role` field must be set to external.

Create Extension Secret.short: Creates a shared secret used to sign and verify JWT tokens.
Create Extension Secret.long: Creates a shared secret used to sign and verify JWT tokens. Creating a new secret removes the current secrets from service. Use this function only when you are ready to use the new secret it returns.

params.name: extension_id
params.description: The ID of the extension to apply the shared secret to.

params.name: delay
params.description: The amount of time, in seconds, to delay activating the secret. The delay should provide enough time for instances of the extension to gracefully switch over to the new secret. The minimum delay is 300 seconds (5 minutes). The default is 300 seconds.

reqBody.name: data
reqBody.description: A list that contains the newly added secrets.

reqBody.name: format_version
reqBody.description: The version number that identifies this definition of the secret’s data.

reqBody.name: secrets
reqBody.description: The list of secrets.

reqBody.name: content
reqBody.description: The raw secret that you use with JWT encoding.

reqBody.name: active_at
reqBody.description: The UTC date and time (in RFC3339 format) that you may begin using this secret to sign a JWT.

reqBody.name: expires_at
reqBody.description: The UTC date and time (in RFC3339 format) that you must stop using this secret to decode a JWT.

codes.200: Successfully created the new secret.
codes.400:
- The extension_id query parameter is required.
- The delay specified in the delay query parameter is too short.
codes.401:
- The Authorization header is required and must specify a JWT token.
- The JWT token is not valid.
- The Client-Id header is required.

Create Extension Secret.auth: Requires a signed JSON Web Token (JWT) created by an Extension Backend Service (EBS). For signing requirements, see [Signing the JWT](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/extensions/building/#signing-the-jwt). The signed JWT must include the `role`, `user_id`, and `exp` fields (see [JWT Schema](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/extensions/reference/#jwt-schema)). The `role` field must be set to external.

Send Extension Chat Message.short: Sends a message to the specified broadcaster’s chat room.
Send Extension Chat Message.long:
Sends a message to the specified broadcaster’s chat room. The extension’s name is used as the username for the message in the chat room. To send a chat message, your extension must enable *Chat Capabilities* (under your extension’s *Capabilities* tab).
*Rate Limits*: You may send a maximum of 12 messages per minute per channel.

params.name: broadcaster_id
params.description: The ID of the broadcaster that has activated the extension.

reqBody.name: text
reqBody.description: The message. The message may contain a maximum of 280 characters.

reqBody.name: extension_id
reqBody.description: The ID of the extension that’s sending the chat message.

reqBody.name: extension_version
reqBody.description: The extension’s version number.

codes.400:
- The broadcaster_id query parameter is required.
- The `extension_id` field in the request's body is required.
- The `extension_version` field in the request's body is required.
- The `text` field in the request's body is required.
- The message is too long.
codes.401:
- The Authorization header is required and must specify a JWT token.
- The ID in the broadcaster_id query parameter must match the `channel_id` claim in the JWT.
- The JWT token is not valid.
- The Client-Id header is required.

Send Extension Chat Message.auth: Requires a signed JSON Web Token (JWT) created by an Extension Backend Service (EBS). For signing requirements, see [Signing the JWT](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/extensions/building/#signing-the-jwt). The signed JWT must include the `role` and `user_id` fields (see [JWT Schema](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/extensions/reference/#jwt-schema)). The `role` field must be set to external.

params.name: extension_id
params.description: The ID of the extension to get.

params.name: extension_version
params.description: The version of the extension to get. If not specified, it returns the latest, released version. If you don’t have a released version, you must specify a version; otherwise, the list is empty.

reqBody.name: data
reqBody.description: A list that contains the specified extension.

reqBody.name: author_name
reqBody.description: The name of the user or organization that owns the extension.

reqBody.name: bits_enabled
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that determines whether the extension has features that use Bits. Is *true* if the extension has features that use Bits.

reqBody.name: can_install
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that determines whether a user can install the extension on their channel. Is *true* if a user can install the extension.Typically, this is set to *false* if the extension is currently in testing mode and requires users to be allowlisted (the allowlist is configured on Twitch’s [developer site](https://dev.twitch.tv/console/extensions) under the *Extensions* -> *Extension* -> *Version* -> *Access*).

reqBody.name: configuration_location
reqBody.description:
The location of where the extension’s configuration is stored. Possible values are:- hosted — The Extensions Configuration Service hosts the configuration.
- custom — The Extension Backend Service (EBS) hosts the configuration.
- none — The extension doesn't require configuration.

reqBody.name: description
reqBody.description: A longer description of the extension. It appears on the details page.

reqBody.name: eula_tos_url
reqBody.description: A URL to the extension’s Terms of Service.

reqBody.name: has_chat_support
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that determines whether the extension can communicate with the installed channel’s chat. Is *true* if the extension can communicate with the channel’s chat room.

reqBody.name: icon_url
reqBody.description: A URL to the default icon that’s displayed in the Extensions directory.

reqBody.name: icon_urls
reqBody.description: A dictionary that contains URLs to different sizes of the default icon. The dictionary’s key identifies the icon’s size (for example, 24x24), and the dictionary’s value contains the URL to the icon.

reqBody.name: id
reqBody.description: The extension’s ID.

reqBody.name: name
reqBody.description: The extension’s name.

reqBody.name: privacy_policy_url
reqBody.description: A URL to the extension’s privacy policy.

reqBody.name: request_identity_link
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that determines whether the extension wants to explicitly ask viewers to link their Twitch identity.

reqBody.name: screenshot_urls
reqBody.description: A list of URLs to screenshots that are shown in the Extensions marketplace.

reqBody.name: state
reqBody.description:
The extension’s state. Possible values are:- Approved
- AssetsUploaded
- Deleted
- Deprecated
- InReview
- InTest
- PendingAction
- Rejected
- Released

reqBody.name: subscriptions_support_level
reqBody.description:
Indicates whether the extension can view the user’s subscription level on the channel that the extension is installed on. Possible values are:- none — The extension can't view the user’s subscription level.
- optional — The extension can view the user’s subscription level.

reqBody.name: summary
reqBody.description: A short description of the extension that streamers see when hovering over the discovery splash screen in the Extensions manager.

reqBody.name: support_email
reqBody.description: The email address that users use to get support for the extension.

reqBody.name: version
reqBody.description: The extension’s version number.

reqBody.name: viewer_summary
reqBody.description: A brief description displayed on the channel to explain how the extension works.

reqBody.name: views
reqBody.description: Describes all views-related information such as how the extension is displayed on mobile devices.

reqBody.name: mobile
reqBody.description: Describes how the extension is displayed on mobile devices.

reqBody.name: viewer_url
reqBody.description: The HTML file that is shown to viewers on mobile devices. This page is presented to viewers as a panel behind the chat area of the mobile app.

reqBody.name: panel
reqBody.description: Describes how the extension is rendered if the extension may be activated as a panel extension.

reqBody.name: viewer_url
reqBody.description: The HTML file that is shown to viewers on the channel page when the extension is activated in a Panel slot.

reqBody.name: height
reqBody.description: The height, in pixels, of the panel component that the extension is rendered in.

reqBody.name: can_link_external_content
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that determines whether the extension can link to non-Twitch domains.

reqBody.name: video_overlay
reqBody.description: Describes how the extension is rendered if the extension may be activated as a video-overlay extension.

reqBody.name: viewer_url
reqBody.description: The HTML file that is shown to viewers on the channel page when the extension is activated on the Video - Overlay slot.

reqBody.name: can_link_external_content
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that determines whether the extension can link to non-Twitch domains.

reqBody.name: component
reqBody.description: Describes how the extension is rendered if the extension may be activated as a video-component extension.

reqBody.name: viewer_url
reqBody.description: The HTML file that is shown to viewers on the channel page when the extension is activated in a Video - Component slot.

reqBody.name: aspect_ratio_x
reqBody.description: The width value of the ratio (width : height) which determines the extension’s width, and how the extension’s iframe will resize in different video player environments.

reqBody.name: aspect_ratio_y
reqBody.description: The height value of the ratio (width : height) which determines the extension’s height, and how the extension’s iframe will resize in different video player environments.

reqBody.name: autoscale
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that determines whether to apply CSS zoom. If *true*, a CSS zoom is applied such that the size of the extension is variable but the inner dimensions are fixed based on Scale Pixels. This allows your extension to render as if it is of fixed width and height. If *false*, the inner dimensions of the extension iframe are variable, meaning your extension must implement responsiveness.

reqBody.name: scale_pixels
reqBody.description: The base width, in pixels, of the extension to use when scaling (see `autoscale`). This value is ignored if `autoscale` is *false*.

reqBody.name: target_height
reqBody.description: The height as a percent of the maximum height of a video component extension. Values are between 1% - 100%.

reqBody.name: can_link_external_content
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that determines whether the extension can link to non-Twitch domains.

reqBody.name: config
reqBody.description: Describes the view that is shown to broadcasters while they are configuring your extension within the Extension Manager.

reqBody.name: viewer_url
reqBody.description: The HTML file shown to broadcasters while they are configuring your extension within the Extension Manager.

reqBody.name: can_link_external_content
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that determines whether the extension can link to non-Twitch domains.

reqBody.name: allowlisted_config_urls
reqBody.description: Allowlisted configuration URLs for displaying the extension (the allowlist is configured on Twitch’s [developer site](https://dev.twitch.tv/console/extensions) under the *Extensions* -> *Extension* -> *Version* -> *Capabilities*).

reqBody.name: allowlisted_panel_urls
reqBody.description: Allowlisted panel URLs for displaying the extension (the allowlist is configured on Twitch’s [developer site](https://dev.twitch.tv/console/extensions) under the *Extensions* -> *Extension* -> *Version* -> *Capabilities*).

codes.200: Successfully retrieved the list of extensions.
codes.400: - The extension_id query parameter is required.
codes.401:
- The request must specify the Authorization header.
- The Authorization header is required and must specify a JWT token.
- The JWT token is not valid.
- The request must specify the Client-Id header.
codes.404: - The extension in the extension_id query parameter was not found.

Get Extensions.auth: Requires a signed JSON Web Token (JWT) created by an Extension Backend Service (EBS). For signing requirements, see [Signing the JWT](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/extensions/building/#signing-the-jwt). The signed JWT must include the `role` field (see [JWT Schema](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/extensions/reference/#jwt-schema)), and the `role` field must be set to external.

Get Released Extensions.short: Gets information about a released extension.
Get Released Extensions.long: Gets information about a released extension. Returns the extension if its `state` is Released.

params.name: extension_id
params.description: The ID of the extension to get.

params.name: extension_version
params.description: The version of the extension to get. If not specified, it returns the latest version.

reqBody.name: data
reqBody.description: A list that contains the specified extension.

reqBody.name: author_name
reqBody.description: The name of the user or organization that owns the extension.

reqBody.name: bits_enabled
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that determines whether the extension has features that use Bits. Is *true* if the extension has features that use Bits.

reqBody.name: can_install
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that determines whether a user can install the extension on their channel. Is *true* if a user can install the extension.Typically, this is set to *false* if the extension is currently in testing mode and requires users to be allowlisted (the allowlist is configured on Twitch’s [developer site](https://dev.twitch.tv/console/extensions) under the *Extensions* -> *Extension* -> *Version* -> *Access*).

reqBody.name: configuration_location
reqBody.description:
The location of where the extension’s configuration is stored. Possible values are:- hosted — The Extensions Configuration Service hosts the configuration.
- custom — The Extension Backend Service (EBS) hosts the configuration.
- none — The extension doesn't require configuration.

reqBody.name: description
reqBody.description: A longer description of the extension. It appears on the details page.

reqBody.name: eula_tos_url
reqBody.description: A URL to the extension’s Terms of Service.

reqBody.name: has_chat_support
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that determines whether the extension can communicate with the installed channel’s chat. Is *true* if the extension can communicate with the channel’s chat room.

reqBody.name: icon_url
reqBody.description: A URL to the default icon that’s displayed in the Extensions directory.

reqBody.name: icon_urls
reqBody.description: A dictionary that contains URLs to different sizes of the default icon. The dictionary’s key identifies the icon’s size (for example, 24x24), and the dictionary’s value contains the URL to the icon.

reqBody.name: id
reqBody.description: The extension’s ID.

reqBody.name: name
reqBody.description: The extension’s name.

reqBody.name: privacy_policy_url
reqBody.description: A URL to the extension’s privacy policy.

reqBody.name: request_identity_link
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that determines whether the extension wants to explicitly ask viewers to link their Twitch identity.

reqBody.name: screenshot_urls
reqBody.description: A list of URLs to screenshots that are shown in the Extensions marketplace.

reqBody.name: state
reqBody.description:
The extension’s state. Possible values are:- Approved
- AssetsUploaded
- Deleted
- Deprecated
- InReview
- InTest
- PendingAction
- Rejected
- Released

reqBody.name: subscriptions_support_level
reqBody.description:
Indicates whether the extension can view the user’s subscription level on the channel that the extension is installed on. Possible values are:- none — The extension can't view the user’s subscription level.
- optional — The extension can view the user’s subscription level.

reqBody.name: summary
reqBody.description: A short description of the extension that streamers see when hovering over the discovery splash screen in the Extensions manager.

reqBody.name: support_email
reqBody.description: The email address that users use to get support for the extension.

reqBody.name: version
reqBody.description: The extension’s version number.

reqBody.name: viewer_summary
reqBody.description: A brief description displayed on the channel to explain how the extension works.

reqBody.name: views
reqBody.description: Describes all views-related information such as how the extension is displayed on mobile devices.

reqBody.name: mobile
reqBody.description: Describes how the extension is displayed on mobile devices.

reqBody.name: viewer_url
reqBody.description: The HTML file that is shown to viewers on mobile devices. This page is presented to viewers as a panel behind the chat area of the mobile app.

reqBody.name: panel
reqBody.description: Describes how the extension is rendered if the extension may be activated as a panel extension.

reqBody.name: viewer_url
reqBody.description: The HTML file that is shown to viewers on the channel page when the extension is activated in a Panel slot.

reqBody.name: height
reqBody.description: The height, in pixels, of the panel component that the extension is rendered in.

reqBody.name: can_link_external_content
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that determines whether the extension can link to non-Twitch domains.

reqBody.name: video_overlay
reqBody.description: Describes how the extension is rendered if the extension may be activated as a video-overlay extension.

reqBody.name: viewer_url
reqBody.description: The HTML file that is shown to viewers on the channel page when the extension is activated on the Video - Overlay slot.

reqBody.name: can_link_external_content
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that determines whether the extension can link to non-Twitch domains.

reqBody.name: component
reqBody.description: Describes how the extension is rendered if the extension may be activated as a video-component extension.

reqBody.name: viewer_url
reqBody.description: The HTML file that is shown to viewers on the channel page when the extension is activated in a Video - Component slot.

reqBody.name: aspect_ratio_x
reqBody.description: The width value of the ratio (width : height) which determines the extension’s width, and how the extension’s iframe will resize in different video player environments.

reqBody.name: aspect_ratio_y
reqBody.description: The height value of the ratio (width : height) which determines the extension’s height, and how the extension’s iframe will resize in different video player environments.

reqBody.name: autoscale
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that determines whether to apply CSS zoom. If *true*, a CSS zoom is applied such that the size of the extension is variable but the inner dimensions are fixed based on Scale Pixels. This allows your extension to render as if it is of fixed width and height. If *false*, the inner dimensions of the extension iframe are variable, meaning your extension must implement responsiveness.

reqBody.name: scale_pixels
reqBody.description: The base width, in pixels, of the extension to use when scaling (see `autoscale`). This value is ignored if `autoscale` is *false*.

reqBody.name: target_height
reqBody.description: The height as a percent of the maximum height of a video component extension. Values are between 1% - 100%.

reqBody.name: can_link_external_content
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that determines whether the extension can link to non-Twitch domains.

reqBody.name: config
reqBody.description: Describes the view that is shown to broadcasters while they are configuring your extension within the Extension Manager.

reqBody.name: viewer_url
reqBody.description: The HTML file shown to broadcasters while they are configuring your extension within the Extension Manager.

reqBody.name: can_link_external_content
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that determines whether the extension can link to non-Twitch domains.

reqBody.name: allowlisted_config_urls
reqBody.description: Allowlisted configuration URLs for displaying the extension (the allowlist is configured on Twitch’s [developer site](https://dev.twitch.tv/console/extensions) under the *Extensions* -> *Extension* -> *Version* -> *Capabilities*).

reqBody.name: allowlisted_panel_urls
reqBody.description: Allowlisted panel URLs for displaying the extension (the allowlist is configured on Twitch’s [developer site](https://dev.twitch.tv/console/extensions) under the *Extensions* -> *Extension* -> *Version* -> *Capabilities*).

codes.200: Successfully retrieved the extension.
codes.400: - The extension_id query parameter is required.
codes.401:
- The Authorization header must specify an app access token or user access token.
- The access token is not valid.
- The ID in the Client-Id header must match the client ID in the access token.
codes.404: - The extension specified in the extension_id query parameter was not found or is not released.

Get Extension Bits Products.short: Gets the list of Bits products that belongs to the extension.
Get Extension Bits Products.long: Gets the list of Bits products that belongs to the extension. The client ID in the app access token identifies the extension.

params.name: should_include_all
params.description: A Boolean value that determines whether to include disabled or expired Bits products in the response. The default is *false*.

reqBody.name: data
reqBody.description: A list of Bits products that the extension created. The list is in ascending SKU order. The list is empty if the extension hasn’t created any products or they’re all expired or disabled.

reqBody.name: sku
reqBody.description: The product’s SKU. The SKU is unique across an extension’s products.

reqBody.name: cost
reqBody.description: An object that contains the product’s cost information.

reqBody.name: amount
reqBody.description: The product’s price.

reqBody.name: type
reqBody.description: The type of currency. Possible values are:- bits

reqBody.name: in_development
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that indicates whether the product is in development. If *true*, the product is not available for public use.

reqBody.name: display_name
reqBody.description: The product’s name as displayed in the extension.

reqBody.name: expiration
reqBody.description: The date and time, in RFC3339 format, when the product expires.

reqBody.name: is_broadcast
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that determines whether Bits product purchase events are broadcast to all instances of an extension on a channel. The events are broadcast via the `onTransactionComplete` helper callback. Is *true* if the event is broadcast to all instances.

codes.200: Successfully retrieved the list of products.
codes.400: - The ID in the Client-Id header must belong to an extension.
codes.401:
- The Authorization header is required and must specify an app access token; you may not specify a user access token.
- The OAuth token is not valid.
- The ID in the Client-Id header must match the Client ID in the OAuth token.

Get Extension Bits Products.auth: Requires an [app access token](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/authentication#app-access-tokens). The client ID in the app access token must be the extension’s client ID.

Update Extension Bits Product.short: Adds or updates a Bits product that the extension created.
Update Extension Bits Product.long: Adds or updates a Bits product that the extension created. If the SKU doesn’t exist, the product is added. You may update all fields except the `sku` field.
Update Extension Bits Product.auth: Requires an [app access token](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/authentication#app-access-tokens). The client ID in the app access token must match the extension’s client ID.

Create EventSub Subscription.auth: If you use [webhooks to receive events](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/eventsub/handling-webhook-events), the request must specify an app access token. The request will fail if you use a user access token. If the subscription type requires user authorization, the user must have granted your app (client ID) permissions to receive those events before you subscribe to them. For example, to subscribe to [channel.subscribe](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/eventsub/eventsub-subscription-types/#channelsubscribe) events, your app must get a user access token that includes the `channel:read:subscriptions` scope, which adds the required permission to your app access token’s client ID.

Delete EventSub Subscription.auth: If you use [webhooks to receive events](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/eventsub/handling-webhook-events), the request must specify an app access token. The request will fail if you use a user access token.

Get EventSub Subscriptions.short: Gets a list of EventSub subscriptions that the client in the access token created.
Get EventSub Subscriptions.long: Gets a list of EventSub subscriptions that the client in the access token created.
Get EventSub Subscriptions.auth: If you use [Webhooks](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/eventsub/handling-webhook-events) or [Conduits](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/eventsub/handling-conduit-events/) to receive events, the request must specify an app access token. The request will fail if you use a user access token.

Get Top Games.short: Gets information about all broadcasts on Twitch.
Get Top Games.long: Gets information about all broadcasts on Twitch.

params.name: first
params.description: The maximum number of items to return per page in the response. The minimum page size is 1 item per page and the maximum is 100 items per page. The default is 20.

params.name: after
params.description: The cursor used to get the next page of results. The *Pagination* object in the response contains the cursor’s value. [Read More](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/api/guide#pagination)

params.name: before
params.description: The cursor used to get the previous page of results. The *Pagination* object in the response contains the cursor’s value. [Read More](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/api/guide#pagination)

reqBody.name: data
reqBody.description: The list of broadcasts. The broadcasts are sorted by the number of viewers, with the most popular first.

reqBody.name: id
reqBody.description: An ID that identifies the category or game.

reqBody.name: name
reqBody.description: The category’s or game’s name.

reqBody.name: box_art_url
reqBody.description: A URL to the category’s or game’s box art. You must replace the `{width}x{height}` placeholder with the size of image you want.

reqBody.name: igdb_id
reqBody.description: The ID that [IGDB](https://www.igdb.com/) uses to identify this game. If the IGDB ID is not available to Twitch, this field is set to an empty string.

reqBody.name: pagination
reqBody.description: Contains the information used to page through the list of results. The object is empty if there are no more pages left to page through. [Read More](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/api/guide#pagination)

reqBody.name: cursor
reqBody.description: The cursor used to get the next page of results. Use the cursor to set the request’s after or before query parameter to get the next or previous page of results.

codes.200: Successfully retrieved the list of broadcasts.
codes.400:
- The value in the first query parameter is not valid.
- The cursor in the after or before query parameter is not valid.
codes.401:
- The Authorization header is required and must specify an app access token or user access token.
- The access token is not valid.
- The ID in the Client-Id header must match the client ID in the access token.

Get Games.long:
Gets information about specified categories or games.
You may get up to 100 categories or games by specifying their ID or name. You may specify all IDs, all names, or a combination of IDs and names. If you specify a combination of IDs and names, the total number of IDs and names must not exceed 100.

params.name: id
params.description: The ID of the category or game to get. Include this parameter for each category or game you want to get. For example, `&id=1234&id=5678`. You may specify a maximum of 100 IDs. The endpoint ignores duplicate and invalid IDs or IDs that weren’t found.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the category or game to get. The name must exactly match the category’s or game’s title. Include this parameter for each category or game you want to get. For example, `&name=foo&name=bar`. You may specify a maximum of 100 names. The endpoint ignores duplicate names and names that weren’t found.

params.name: igdb_id
params.description: The [IGDB](https://www.igdb.com/) ID of the game to get. Include this parameter for each game you want to get. For example, `&igdb_id=1234&igdb_id=5678`. You may specify a maximum of 100 IDs. The endpoint ignores duplicate and invalid IDs or IDs that weren’t found.

reqBody.name: data
reqBody.description: The list of categories and games. The list is empty if the specified categories and games weren’t found.

reqBody.name: id
reqBody.description: An ID that identifies the category or game.

reqBody.name: name
reqBody.description: The category’s or game’s name.

reqBody.name: box_art_url
reqBody.description: A URL to the category’s or game’s box art. You must replace the `{width}x{height}` placeholder with the size of image you want.

reqBody.name: igdb_id
reqBody.description: The ID that [IGDB](https://www.igdb.com/) uses to identify this game. If the IGDB ID is not available to Twitch, this field is set to an empty string.

codes.200: Successfully retrieved the specified games.
codes.400:
- The request must specify the id or name or igdb_id query parameter.
- The combined number of game IDs (id and igdb_id) and game names that you specify in the request must not exceed 100.
codes.401:
- The Authorization header is required and must specify an app access token or user access token.
- The access token is not valid.
- The ID in the Client-Id header must match the client ID in the access token.

Get Creator Goals.short: Gets the broadcaster’s list of active goals.
Get Creator Goals.long:
Gets the broadcaster’s list of active goals. Use this endpoint to get the current progress of each goal.
Instead of polling for the progress of a goal, consider [subscribing](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/eventsub/manage-subscriptions) to receive notifications when a goal makes progress using the [channel.goal.progress](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/eventsub/eventsub-subscription-types#channelgoalprogress) subscription type. [Read More](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/api/goals#requesting-event-notifications)

params.name: broadcaster_id
params.description: The ID of the broadcaster that created the goals. This ID must match the user ID in the user access token.

reqBody.name: data
reqBody.description: The list of goals. The list is empty if the broadcaster hasn’t created goals.

reqBody.name: id
reqBody.description: An ID that identifies this goal.

reqBody.name: broadcaster_id
reqBody.description: An ID that identifies the broadcaster that created the goal.

reqBody.name: broadcaster_name
reqBody.description: The broadcaster’s display name.

reqBody.name: broadcaster_login
reqBody.description: The broadcaster’s login name.

reqBody.name: type
reqBody.description:
The type of goal. Possible values are: - follower — The goal is to increase followers.
- subscription — The goal is to increase subscriptions. This type shows the net increase or decrease in tier points associated with the subscriptions.
- subscription_count — The goal is to increase subscriptions. This type shows the net increase or decrease in the number of subscriptions.
- new_subscription — The goal is to increase subscriptions. This type shows only the net increase in tier points associated with the subscriptions (it does not account for users that unsubscribed since the goal started).
- new_subscription_count — The goal is to increase subscriptions. This type shows only the net increase in the number of subscriptions (it does not account for users that unsubscribed since the goal started).

reqBody.name: description
reqBody.description: A description of the goal. Is an empty string if not specified.

reqBody.name: current_amount
reqBody.description:
The goal’s current value.The goal’s `type` determines how this value is increased or decreased. - If `type` is follower, this field is set to the broadcaster's current number of followers. This number increases with new followers and decreases when users unfollow the broadcaster.
- If `type` is subscription, this field is increased and decreased by the points value associated with the subscription tier. For example, if a tier-two subscription is worth 2 points, this field is increased or decreased by 2, not 1.
- If `type` is subscription_count, this field is increased by 1 for each new subscription and decreased by 1 for each user that unsubscribes.
- If `type` is new_subscription, this field is increased by the points value associated with the subscription tier. For example, if a tier-two subscription is worth 2 points, this field is increased by 2, not 1.
- If `type` is new_subscription_count, this field is increased by 1 for each new subscription.

reqBody.name: target_amount
reqBody.description: The goal’s target value. For example, if the broadcaster has 200 followers before creating the goal, and their goal is to double that number, this field is set to 400.

reqBody.name: created_at
reqBody.description: The UTC date and time (in RFC3339 format) that the broadcaster created the goal.

codes.200: Successfully retrieved the broadcaster’s goals.
codes.400: - The broadcaster_id query parameter is required.
codes.401:
- The Authorization header is required and must contain a user access token.
- The user access token must include the channel:read:goals scope.
- The ID in broadcaster_id must match the user ID in the user access token.
- The access token is not valid.
- The client ID specified in the Client-Id header does not match the client ID specified in the access token.

Get Creator Goals.auth: Requires a [user access token](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/authentication#user-access-tokens) that includes the *channel:read:goals* scope.

Get Channel Guest Star Settings.short: BETA Gets the channel settings for configuration of the Guest Star feature for a particular host.
Get Channel Guest Star Settings.long: BETA Gets the channel settings for configuration of the Guest Star feature for a particular host.

params.name: broadcaster_id
params.description: The ID of the broadcaster you want to get guest star settings for.

params.name: moderator_id
params.description: The ID of the broadcaster or a user that has permission to moderate the broadcaster’s chat room. This ID must match the user ID in the user access token.

reqBody.name: is_moderator_send_live_enabled
reqBody.description: Flag determining if Guest Star moderators have access to control whether a guest is live once assigned to a slot.

reqBody.name: slot_count
reqBody.description: Number of slots the Guest Star call interface will allow the host to add to a call. Required to be between 1 and 6.

reqBody.name: is_browser_source_audio_enabled
reqBody.description: Flag determining if Browser Sources subscribed to sessions on this channel should output audio

reqBody.name: group_layout
reqBody.description:
This setting determines how the guests within a session should be laid out within the browser source. Can be one of the following values: - `TILED_LAYOUT`: All live guests are tiled within the browser source with the same size.
- `SCREENSHARE_LAYOUT`: All live guests are tiled within the browser source with the same size. If there is an active screen share, it is sized larger than the other guests.

reqBody.name: browser_source_token
reqBody.description: View only token to generate browser source URLs

codes.400:
- Missing broadcaster_id
- Missing moderator_id
codes.403: Insufficient authorization for viewing channel’s Guest Star settings

Get Channel Guest Star Settings.auth:
- Query parameter `moderator_id` must match the `user_id` in the [User-Access token](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/authentication#user-access-tokens)
- Requires OAuth Scope: `channel:read:guest_star`, `channel:manage:guest_star`, `moderator:read:guest_star` or `moderator:manage:guest_star`

Update Channel Guest Star Settings.short: BETA Mutates the channel settings for configuration of the Guest Star feature for a particular host.
Update Channel Guest Star Settings.long: BETA Mutates the channel settings for configuration of the Guest Star feature for a particular host.

params.name: broadcaster_id
params.description: The ID of the broadcaster you want to update Guest Star settings for.

reqBody.name: is_moderator_send_live_enabled
reqBody.description: Flag determining if Guest Star moderators have access to control whether a guest is live once assigned to a slot.

reqBody.name: slot_count
reqBody.description: Number of slots the Guest Star call interface will allow the host to add to a call. Required to be between 1 and 6.

reqBody.name: is_browser_source_audio_enabled
reqBody.description: Flag determining if Browser Sources subscribed to sessions on this channel should output audio

reqBody.name: group_layout
reqBody.description:
This setting determines how the guests within a session should be laid out within the browser source. Can be one of the following values: - `TILED_LAYOUT`: All live guests are tiled within the browser source with the same size.
- `SCREENSHARE_LAYOUT`: All live guests are tiled within the browser source with the same size. If there is an active screen share, it is sized larger than the other guests.
- `HORIZONTAL_LAYOUT`: All live guests are arranged in a horizontal bar within the browser source
- `VERTICAL_LAYOUT`: All live guests are arranged in a vertical bar within the browser source

reqBody.name: regenerate_browser_sources
reqBody.description: Flag determining if Guest Star should regenerate the auth token associated with the channel’s browser sources. Providing a true value for this will immediately invalidate all browser sources previously configured in your streaming software.

codes.400:
- Missing broadcaster_id
- Invalid slot_count
- Invalid group_layout

Update Channel Guest Star Settings.auth:
- Query parameter `broadcaster_id` must match the `user_id` in the [User-Access token](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/authentication#user-access-tokens)
- Requires OAuth Scope: `channel:manage:guest_star`

Get Guest Star Session.short: BETA Gets information about an ongoing Guest Star session for a particular channel.
Get Guest Star Session.long: BETA Gets information about an ongoing Guest Star session for a particular channel.

params.name: broadcaster_id
params.description: ID for the user hosting the Guest Star session.

params.name: moderator_id
params.description: The ID of the broadcaster or a user that has permission to moderate the broadcaster’s chat room. This ID must match the user ID in the user access token.

reqBody.name: data
reqBody.description: Summary of the session details

reqBody.name: id
reqBody.description: ID uniquely representing the Guest Star session.

reqBody.name: guests
reqBody.description: List of guests currently interacting with the Guest Star session.

reqBody.name: slot_id
reqBody.description:
ID representing this guest’s slot assignment. - Host is always in slot "0"
- Guests are assigned the following consecutive IDs (e.g, "1", "2", "3", etc)
- Screen Share is represented as a special guest with the ID "SCREENSHARE"
- The identifier here matches the ID referenced in browser source links used in broadcasting software.

reqBody.name: is_live
reqBody.description: Flag determining whether or not the guest is visible in the browser source in the host’s streaming software.

reqBody.name: user_id
reqBody.description: User ID of the guest assigned to this slot.

reqBody.name: user_display_name
reqBody.description: Display name of the guest assigned to this slot.

reqBody.name: user_login
reqBody.description: Login of the guest assigned to this slot.

reqBody.name: volume
reqBody.description: Value from 0 to 100 representing the host’s volume setting for this guest.

reqBody.name: assigned_at
reqBody.description: Timestamp when this guest was assigned a slot in the session.

reqBody.name: audio_settings
reqBody.description: Information about the guest’s audio settings

reqBody.name: is_host_enabled
reqBody.description: Flag determining whether the host is allowing the guest’s audio to be seen or heard within the session.

reqBody.name: is_guest_enabled
reqBody.description: Flag determining whether the guest is allowing their audio to be transmitted to the session.

reqBody.name: is_available
reqBody.description: Flag determining whether the guest has an appropriate audio device available to be transmitted to the session.

reqBody.name: video_settings
reqBody.description: Information about the guest’s video settings

reqBody.name: is_host_enabled
reqBody.description: Flag determining whether the host is allowing the guest’s video to be seen or heard within the session.

reqBody.name: is_guest_enabled
reqBody.description: Flag determining whether the guest is allowing their video to be transmitted to the session.

reqBody.name: is_available
reqBody.description: Flag determining whether the guest has an appropriate video device available to be transmitted to the session.

codes.400:
- Missing broadcaster_id
- Missing moderator_id
codes.401: moderator_id and user token do not match

Get Guest Star Session.auth:
- Requires OAuth Scope: `channel:read:guest_star`, `channel:manage:guest_star`, `moderator:read:guest_star` or `moderator:manage:guest_star`
- Guests must be either invited or assigned a slot within the session

Create Guest Star Session.short: BETA Programmatically creates a Guest Star session on behalf of the broadcaster.
Create Guest Star Session.long: BETA Programmatically creates a Guest Star session on behalf of the broadcaster. Requires the broadcaster to be present in the call interface, or the call will be ended automatically.

params.name: broadcaster_id
params.description: The ID of the broadcaster you want to create a Guest Star session for. Provided `broadcaster_id` must match the `user_id` in the auth token.

reqBody.name: data
reqBody.description: Summary of the session details.

reqBody.name: id
reqBody.description: ID uniquely representing the Guest Star session.

reqBody.name: guests
reqBody.description: List of guests currently interacting with the Guest Star session. On creation, the session will contain the broadcaster as a solo guest.

reqBody.name: slot_id
reqBody.description:
ID representing this guest’s slot assignment. - Host is always in slot "0"
- Guests are assigned the following consecutive IDs (e.g, "1", "2", "3", etc)
- Screen Share is represented as a special guest with the ID "SCREENSHARE"
- The identifier here matches the ID referenced in browser source links used in broadcasting software.

reqBody.name: is_live
reqBody.description: Flag determining whether or not the guest is visible in the browser source in the host’s streaming software.

reqBody.name: user_id
reqBody.description: User ID of the guest assigned to this slot.

reqBody.name: user_display_name
reqBody.description: Display name of the guest assigned to this slot.

reqBody.name: user_login
reqBody.description: Login of the guest assigned to this slot.

reqBody.name: volume

Get Guest Star Invites.short: BETA Provides the caller with a list of pending invites to a Guest Star session.
Get Guest Star Invites.long: BETA Provides the caller with a list of pending invites to a Guest Star session, including the invitee’s ready status while joining the waiting room.

params.name: broadcaster_id
params.description: The ID of the broadcaster running the Guest Star session.

params.name: moderator_id
params.description: The ID of the broadcaster or a user that has permission to moderate the broadcaster’s chat room. This ID must match the `user_id` in the user access token.

params.name: session_id
params.description: The session ID to query for invite status.

reqBody.name: data
reqBody.description: A list of invite objects describing the invited user as well as their ready status.

reqBody.name: user_id
reqBody.description: Twitch User ID corresponding to the invited guest

reqBody.name: invited_at
reqBody.description: Timestamp when this user was invited to the session.

reqBody.name: status
reqBody.description:
Status representing the invited user’s join state. Can be one of the following: - `INVITED`: The user has been invited to the session but has not acknowledged it.
- `ACCEPTED`: The invited user has acknowledged the invite and joined the waiting room, but may still be setting up their media devices or otherwise preparing to join the call.
- `READY`: The invited user has signaled they are ready to join the call from the waiting room.

reqBody.name: is_video_enabled
reqBody.description: Flag signaling that the invited user has chosen to disable their local video device. The user has hidden themselves, but they may choose to reveal their video feed upon joining the session.

reqBody.name: is_audio_enabled
reqBody.description: Flag signaling that the invited user has chosen to disable their local audio device. The user has muted themselves, but they may choose to unmute their audio feed upon joining the session.

reqBody.name: is_video_available
reqBody.description: Flag signaling that the invited user has a video device available for sharing.

reqBody.name: is_audio_available
reqBody.description: Flag signaling that the invited user has an audio device available for sharing.

These settings will be broadcasted to all subscribers which control their view of the guest in that slot. One or more of the optional parameters to this API can be specified at any time.

params.name: broadcaster_id
params.description: The ID of the broadcaster running the Guest Star session.

params.name: volume
params.description: Value from 0-100 that controls the audio volume for shared views containing the slot.

Check AutoMod Status.short: Checks whether AutoMod would flag the specified message for review.
Check AutoMod Status.long:
Checks whether AutoMod would flag the specified message for review.
AutoMod is a moderation tool that holds inappropriate or harassing chat messages for moderators to review. Moderators approve or deny the messages that AutoMod flags; only approved messages are released to chat. AutoMod detects misspellings and evasive language automatically. For information about AutoMod, see [How to Use AutoMod](https://help.twitch.tv/s/article/how-to-use-automod).
*Rate Limits*: Rates are limited per channel based on the account type rather than per access token.
Account type Limit per minute Limit per hour Normal 5 50 Affiliate 10 100 Partner 30 300
The above limits are in addition to the standard [Twitch API rate limits](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/api/guide#twitch-rate-limits). The rate limit headers in the response represent the Twitch rate limits and not the above limits.

params.name: broadcaster_id
params.description: The ID of the broadcaster whose AutoMod settings and list of blocked terms are used to check the message. This ID must match the user ID in the access token.

reqBody.name: data
reqBody.description: The list of messages to check. The list must contain at least one message and may contain up to a maximum of 100 messages.

reqBody.name: msg_id
reqBody.description: A caller-defined ID used to correlate this message with the same message in the response.

reqBody.name: msg_text
reqBody.description: The message to check.

reqBody.name: data
reqBody.description: The list of messages and whether Twitch would approve them for chat.

reqBody.name: msg_id
reqBody.description: The caller-defined ID passed in the request.

reqBody.name: is_permitted
reqBody.description: A Boolean value that indicates whether Twitch would approve the message for chat or hold it for moderator review or block it from chat. Is *true* if Twitch would approve the message; otherwise, *false* if Twitch would hold the message for moderator review or block it from chat.

codes.200: Successfully checked the messages.
codes.400:
- The broadcaster_id query parameter is required.
- The `data` field is required and the list must contain one or more messages to check.
- The `msg_id` field is required.
- The `msg_text` field is required.
codes.401:
- The Authorization header is required and must contain a user access token.
- The user access token must include the moderation:read scope.
- The access token is not valid.
- The client ID specified in the Client-Id header does not match the client ID specified in the access token.
codes.403: - The ID in broadcaster_id must match the user ID in the user access token.
codes.429: - The broadcaster exceeded the number of chat message checks that they may make. See the endpoint's rate limits.

Check AutoMod Status.auth: Requires a [user access token](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/authentication#user-access-tokens) that includes the *moderation:read* scope.

Manage Held AutoMod Messages.short: Allow or deny the message that AutoMod flagged for review.
Manage Held AutoMod Messages.long:
Allow or deny the message that AutoMod flagged for review. For information about AutoMod, see [How to Use AutoMod](https://help.twitch.tv/s/article/how-to-use-automod).
To get messages that AutoMod is holding for review, subscribe to the *automod-queue.<moderator_id>.<channel_id>* [topic](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/pubsub#topics) using [PubSub](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/pubsub). PubSub sends a notification to your app when AutoMod holds a message for review.

reqBody.name: user_id
reqBody.description: The moderator who is approving or denying the held message. This ID must match the user ID in the access token.

reqBody.name: msg_id
reqBody.description: The ID of the message to allow or deny.

reqBody.name: action
reqBody.description:
The action to take for the message. Possible values are:- ALLOW
- DENY

codes.204: Successfully approved or denied the message.
codes.400:
- The value in the `action` field is not valid.
- The `user_id` field is required.
- The `msg_id` field is required.
- The `action` field is required.
codes.401:
- The ID in `user_id` must match the user ID in the user access token.
- The Authorization header is required and must contain a user access token.
- The user access token must include the moderator:manage:automod scope.
- The access token is not valid.
- The client ID specified in the Client-Id header does not match the client ID specified in the access token.
codes.403: - The user in user_id is not one of the broadcaster's moderators.
codes.404: - The message specified in the `msg_id` field was not found.

Manage Held AutoMod Messages.auth: Requires a [user access token](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/authentication#user-access-tokens) that includes the *moderator:manage:automod* scope.

Update AutoMod Settings.auth: Requires a [user access token](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/authentication#user-access-tokens) that includes the *moderator:manage:automod_settings* scope.
Update AutoMod Settings.reqBodyInfo:
Because PUT is an overwrite operation, you must include all the fields that you want set after the operation completes. Typically, you’ll send a GET request, update the fields you want to change, and pass that object in the PUT request.
You may set either `overall_level` or the individual settings like `aggression`, but not both.
Setting `overall_level` applies default values to the individual settings. However, setting `overall_level` to 4 does not necessarily mean that it applies 4 to all the individual settings. Instead, it applies a set of recommended defaults to the rest of the settings. For example, if you set `overall_level` to 2, Twitch provides some filtering on discrimination and sexual content, but more filtering on hostility (see the first example response).
If `overall_level` is currently set and you update `swearing` to 3, `overall_level` will be set to *null* and all settings other than `swearing` will be set to 0. The same is true if individual settings are set and you update `overall_level` to 3 — all the individual settings are updated to reflect the default level.
Note that if you set all the individual settings to values that match what `overall_level` would have set them to, Twitch changes AutoMod to use the default AutoMod level instead of using the individual settings.
Valid values for all levels are from 0 (no filtering) through 4 (most aggressive filtering). These levels affect how aggressively AutoMod holds back messages for moderators to review before they appear in chat or are denied (not shown).

Get Banned Users.short: Gets all users that the broadcaster banned or put in a timeout.
Get Banned Users.long: Gets all users that the broadcaster banned or put in a timeout.

params.name: broadcaster_id
params.description: The ID of the broadcaster whose list of banned users you want to get. This ID must match the user ID in the access token.

params.name: user_id
params.description: A list of user IDs used to filter the results. To specify more than one ID, include this parameter for each user you want to get. For example, `user_id=1234&user_id=5678`. You may specify a maximum of 100 IDs.The returned list includes only those users that were banned or put in a timeout. The list is returned in the same order that you specified the IDs.

params.description: The cursor used to get the next page of results. The *Pagination* object in the response contains the cursor’s value. [Read More](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/api/guide#pagination)

Ban User.short: Bans a user from participating in a broadcaster’s chat room or puts them in a timeout.
Ban User.long:
Bans a user from participating in the specified broadcaster’s chat room or puts them in a timeout.
For information about banning or putting users in a timeout, see [Ban a User](https://help.twitch.tv/s/article/how-to-manage-harassment-in-chat#TheBanFeature) and [Timeout a User](https://help.twitch.tv/s/article/how-to-manage-harassment-in-chat#TheTimeoutFeature).
If the user is currently in a timeout, you can call this endpoint to change the duration of the timeout or ban them altogether. If the user is currently banned, you cannot call this method to put them in a timeout instead.
To remove a ban or end a timeout, see [Unban user](#unban-user).

params.name: broadcaster_id
params.description: The ID of the broadcaster whose chat room the user is being banned from.

params.name: moderator_id
params.description: The ID of the broadcaster or a user that has permission to moderate the broadcaster’s chat room. This ID must match the user ID in the user access token.

reqBody.name: data
reqBody.description: Identifies the user and type of ban.

reqBody.name: user_id
reqBody.description: The ID of the user to ban or put in a timeout.

reqBody.name: duration
reqBody.description: To ban a user indefinitely, don’t include this field.To put a user in a timeout, include this field and specify the timeout period, in seconds. The minimum timeout is 1 second and the maximum is 1,209,600 seconds (2 weeks).To end a user’s timeout early, set this field to 1, or use the [Unban user](#unban-user) endpoint.

reqBody.name: reason
reqBody.description: The reason the you’re banning the user or putting them in a timeout. The text is user defined and is limited to a maximum of 500 characters.

reqBody.name: data
reqBody.description: A list that contains the user you successfully banned or put in a timeout.

reqBody.name: broadcaster_id
reqBody.description: The broadcaster whose chat room the user was banned from chatting in.

reqBody.name: moderator_id
reqBody.description: The moderator that banned or put the user in the timeout.

reqBody.name: user_id
reqBody.description: The user that was banned or put in a timeout.

reqBody.name: created_at
reqBody.description: The UTC date and time (in RFC3339 format) that the ban or timeout was placed.

reqBody.name: end_time
reqBody.description: The UTC date and time (in RFC3339 format) that the timeout will end. Is *null* if the user was banned instead of being put in a timeout.

codes.200: Successfully banned the user or placed them in a timeout.
codes.400:
- The broadcaster_id query parameter is required.
- The moderator_id query parameter is required.

- The text in the `reason` field is too long.
- The value in the `duration` field is not valid.
- The user specified in the `user_id` field may not be banned.
- The user specified in the `user_id` field may not be put in a timeout.
- The user specified in the `user_id` field is already banned.
codes.401:
- The ID in moderator_id must match the user ID in the access token.
- The Authorization header is required and must contain a user access token.
- The user access token must include the moderator:manage:banned_users scope.
- The access token is not valid.
- The client ID specified in the Client-Id header does not match the client ID specified in the access token.
codes.403: - The user in moderator_id is not one of the broadcaster's moderators.
codes.409: - You may not update the user's ban state while someone else is updating the state. For example, someone else is currently banning the user or putting them in a timeout, moving the user from a timeout to a ban, or removing the user from a ban or timeout. Please retry your request.
codes.429: - The app has exceeded the number of requests it may make per minute for this broadcaster.

Delete Chat Messages.short: Removes a single chat message or all chat messages from the broadcaster’s chat room.
Delete Chat Messages.long: Removes a single chat message or all chat messages from the broadcaster’s chat room.

params.name: broadcaster_id
params.description: The ID of the broadcaster that owns the chat room to remove messages from.

params.name: moderator_id
params.description: The ID of the broadcaster or a user that has permission to moderate the broadcaster’s chat room. This ID must match the user ID in the user access token.

params.name: message_id
params.description:
The ID of the message to remove. The `id` tag in the [PRIVMSG](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/irc/tags#privmsg-tags) tag contains the message’s ID. Restrictions:- The message must have been created within the last 6 hours.
- The message must not belong to the broadcaster.
- The message must not belong to another moderator.
If not specified, the request removes all messages in the broadcaster’s chat room.

codes.400:
- You may not delete another moderator's messages.
- You may not delete the broadcaster's messages.
codes.401:
- The Authorization header is required and must contain a user access token.
- The user access token is missing the moderator:manage:chat_messages scope.
- The OAuth token is not valid.
- The client ID specified in the Client-Id header does not match the client ID specified in the OAuth token.
codes.403: - The user in moderator_id is not one of the broadcaster's moderators.
codes.404:
- The ID in message_id was not found.
- The specified message was created more than 6 hours ago.

Delete Chat Messages.auth: Requires a [user access token](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/authentication#user-access-tokens) that includes the *moderator:manage:chat_messages* scope.

Get Moderated Channels.short: Gets a list of channels that the specified user has moderator privileges in.
Get Moderated Channels.long: Gets a list of channels that the specified user has moderator privileges in.

params.name: user_id

params.name: after
params.description: The cursor used to get the next page of results. The Pagination object in the response contains the cursor’s value.

params.name: first
params.description: The maximum number of items to return per page in the response.Minimum page size is 1 item per page and the maximum is 100. The default is 20.

reqBody.name: data
reqBody.description: The list of channels that the user has moderator privileges in.

reqBody.name: broadcaster_id
reqBody.description: An ID that uniquely identifies the channel this user can moderate.

reqBody.name: broadcaster_login
reqBody.description: The channel’s login name.

reqBody.name: broadcaster_name
reqBody.description: The channels’ display name.

reqBody.name: pagination

reqBody.name: cursor
reqBody.description: The cursor used to get the next page of results. Use the cursor to set the request’s after query parameter.

Get Moderated Channels.auth:
- Query parameter `user_id` must match the user ID in the [User-Access token](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/authentication#user-access-tokens)

Get Moderators.short: Gets all users allowed to moderate the broadcaster’s chat room.
Get Moderators.long: Gets all users allowed to moderate the broadcaster’s chat room.

params.name: user_id

You may specify a maximum of 100 IDs.The returned list includes only the users from the list who are moderators in the broadcaster’s channel. The list is returned in the same order as you specified the IDs.

params.name: first

params.name: after
params.description: The cursor used to get the next page of results. The *Pagination* object in the response contains the cursor’s value. [Read More](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/api/guide#pagination)

reqBody.name: data

reqBody.name: user_login

reqBody.name: user_name
reqBody.description: The user’s display name.

reqBody.name: pagination
reqBody.description: Contains the information used to page through the list of results. The object is empty if there are no more pages left to page through. [Read More](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/api/guide#pagination)

reqBody.name: cursor
reqBody.description: The cursor used to get the next page of results. Use the cursor to set the request’s after query parameter.

codes.200: Successfully retrieved the list of moderators.
codes.400: - The broadcaster_id query parameter is required.
codes.401:
- The ID in broadcaster_id must match the user ID found in the access token.
- The Authorization header is required and must contain a user access token.
- The user access token must include the moderation:read scope.

Get Moderators.auth: Requires a [user access token](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/authentication#user-access-tokens) that includes the *moderation:read* scope. If your app also adds and removes moderators, you can use the *channel:manage:moderators* scope instead.

Add Channel Moderator.short: Adds a moderator to the broadcaster’s chat room.
Add Channel Moderator.long:
Adds a moderator to the broadcaster’s chat room.
*Rate Limits*: The broadcaster may add a maximum of 10 moderators within a 10-second window.

params.name: broadcaster_id
params.description: The ID of the broadcaster that owns the chat room. This ID must match the user ID in the access token.

params.name: user_id
params.description: The ID of the user to add as a moderator in the broadcaster’s chat room.

codes.400:
- The ID in broadcaster_id was not found.
- The ID in user_id was not found.
- The user in user_id is already a moderator in the broadcaster's chat room.
- The user in user_id cannot become a moderator because they're banned from the channel.
codes.401:
- The Authorization header is required and must contain a user access token.
- The user access token must include the channel:manage:moderators scope.
- The access token is not valid.
- The ID in the broadcaster_id query parameter must match the user ID in the access token.
- The client ID specified in the Client-Id header does not match the client ID specified in the access token.
codes.422: - The user in user_id is a VIP. To make them a moderator, you must first remove them as a VIP (see [Remove Channel VIP](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/api/reference#remove-channel-vip)).
codes.429: - The broadcaster has exceeded the number of requests allowed within a 10-second window. See this endpoint's rate limits.

Add Channel Moderator.auth: Requires a [user access token](https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/authentication#user-access-tokens) that includes the *channel:manage:moderators* scope.

Remove Channel Moderator.long:

params.name: broadcaster_id
